str_town_alt_prosperity_0|Those few items sold in the market appear to be priced well out of the range of the inhabitants. The people are malnourished, their animals are sick or dying, and the tools of their trade appear to be broken. The back alleys have been abandoned to flies and mangy dogs.{***}

str_town_alt_prosperity_20|You hear grumbling in the marketplace about the price of everyday items and the shops are half empty. You see the signs of malnourishment on both people and animals, and both buildings and tools suffer from lack of repair. Many may already have migrated to seek work elsewhere.{***}

str_town_alt_prosperity_40|You hear the occasional grumble in the marketplace about the price of everyday items, but there appear to be a reasonable amount of goods for sale. You see the occasional abandoned building, shop, or cart, but nothing more than the ordinary.{***}
str_town_alt_prosperity_60|The people look well-fed and relatively content. Craftsmen do a thriving business, and some migrants appear to be coming here from other regions to seek their luck.{***}

str_town_alt_prosperity_80|The walls, streets, and homes are well-maintained. The markets are thronged with migrants from the nearby regions drawn here by the availability of both goods and work. The rhythm of hammers and looms speak to the business of the artisans' workshops.{***}

str_village_alt_prosperity_0|Only a handful of people are strong enough to work in the fields, many of which are becoming overgrown with weeds. The rest are weak and malnourished, or have already fled elsewhere. The draft animals have long since starved or were eaten, although a few carcasses still lie on the outskirts, their bones gnawed by wild beasts.{***}

str_village_alt_prosperity_20|Some farmers and animals are out in the fields, but their small numbers suggest that some villagers may be emigrating in search of food. Farm implements look rusty and broken. Brush and weeds seem to be reclaiming some of the outermost fields.{***}

str_village_alt_prosperity_40|The fields and orchards are busy, with villagers engaged in the tasks of the seasons. Humans and animals alike look relatively healthy and well-fed. However, a small number of the outermost fields are left unsewn, and some walls are in ill repair, suggesting that there are still not quite enough hands to do all the work which needs to be done.{***}

str_village_alt_prosperity_60|The fields and orchards are humming with activity, with filled sacks of grain and drying meat testifying to the productivity of the village's crop land and pasture land.{***}

str_village_alt_prosperity_80|The fields and orchards are humming with activity, with freshly dug irrigation ditches suggesting that the farmers have enough spare time and energy to expand the area under cultivation. Seasonal labourers appear to be flocking here to help with the work and join in the general prosperity.{***}

str_oasis_village_alt_prosperity_0|The fruit groves are virtually abandoned, and the canals which irrigate them are clogged with silt. The handful of villagers you see look malnourished and restless. The draft animals have long since starved or were eaten, although a few carcasses still lie on the outskirts, their bones gnawed by the wolves.{***}

str_oasis_village_alt_prosperity_20|Few villagers can be seen tending to the fruit groves, and in places, the ruins appear to be encroaching on the gardens. Many of the canals are clogged with silt, and the wells and cisterns are filled with sand.{***}

str_oasis_village_alt_prosperity_40|Men and women are busy tending the fruit groves, climbing to the tops of trees to pollinate the fruit. Healthy animals draw the pumps and wheels that bring water to the fields. Some of the irrigation canals and cisterns, however, could use some maintenance.{***}

str_oasis_village_alt_prosperity_60|The fruit groves and orchards are humming with activity. Farmers call to each other cheerfully from the tops of the trees, where they pollinate the fruit. The creak of wooden pumps, the bellowing of draft animals, and the rush of flowing water speak of an irrigation system that is thriving under the villagers' attention.{***}

str_oasis_village_alt_prosperity_80|The fruit groves are humming with activity, as farmers load up a bumper crop of apples for sale to the market. Men and women are hard at work digging new wells and canals, to bring additional land under irrigation.{***}

str_persuasion_summary_very_bad|You try your best to persuade {s50}, but none of your arguments seem to come out right. Every time you start to make sense, you seem to say something entirely wrong that puts you off track. By the time you finish speaking you've failed to form a single coherent point in your own favour, and you realise that all you've done was dig yourself a deeper hole. Unsurprisingly, {s50} does not look impressed.{***}

str_persuasion_summary_bad|You try to persuade {s50}, but {reg51?she:he} outmanoeuvres you from the very start. Even your best arguments sound hollow to your own ears. {s50}, likewise, has not formed a very high opinion of what you had to say.{***}

str_persuasion_summary_average|{s50} turns out to be a skilled speaker with a keen mind, and you can't seem to bring forth anything concrete that {reg51?she:he} cannot counter with a rational point. In the end, neither of you manage to gain any ground in this discussion.{***}

str_persuasion_summary_good|Through quick thinking and smooth argumentation, you manage to state your case well, forcing {s50} to concede on several points. However, {reg51?she:he} still expresses doubts about your request.{***}

str_persuasion_summary_very_good|You deliver an impassioned speech that echoes through all listening ears like poetry. The world itself seems to quiet down in order to hear you better . The inspiring words have moved {s50} deeply, and {reg51?she:he} looks much more well-disposed towards helping you.{***}

str_persuasion_summary_very_bad_center|You try your best to persuade the Commander at {s50}, though unfortunately he doesn't seem to trust you enough. You already realise this is not going to end well and figure this was probably not one of your better ideas.^ After a short while the Commander of {s50} decides not to offer an exchange.{***}

str_persuasion_summary_bad_center|You try to persuade the Commander at {s50}, but {reg51?she:he} looks very disinterested from the very start.  Already you know they are not going to give up without a fight, so you decide to leave.{***}

str_persuasion_summary_average_center|The Commander of {s50} shows a reluctance to co-operate and your request has fallen upon deaf ears,  You decide this is not going to go anywhere fast and decide to leave.{***}
str_persuasion_summary_good_center|Although the Commander of {s50} seems to show some inclination of an exchange,   {reg51?she:he} still expresses doubts about your request.{***}
str_persuasion_summary_very_good_center|Your request has been successful. The Commander of {s50} is happy with your terms   and {reg51?she:he} seems much more well-disposed towards helping you.{***}

str_banner_selection_text|You have been awarded the right to carry a banner which will display your sigil. Your banner will signify your status and bring honour to you and your House. Which banner do you want to choose?{***}

str_retirement_text_1|Only too late do you realise that your money won't last. It doesn't take you long to fritter away what little you bothered to save, and you fare poorly in several desperate attempts to start adventuring again. You end up a beggar in {s9}, living on alms and the charity of the church.{***}

str_retirement_text_2|Only too late do you realise that your money won't last. It doesn't take you long to fritter away what little you bothered to save. Once every silver stag has evaporated in your hands you are forced to start a life of crime in the backstreet's of {s9}, using your skills to eke out a living robbing coppers from women and poor townsmen.{***}

str_retirement_text_3|Only too late do you realise that your money won't last. It doesn't take you long to fritter away what little you bothered to save, and you end up a penniless drifter, going from tavern to tavern blagging drinks from indulgent patrons by regaling them with war stories that no one ever believes.{***}

str_retirement_text_4|The silver you've saved doesn't last long, but you manage to put together enough to buy some land near the village of {s7}. There you become a free farmer, and you soon begin to attract potential {wives/husbands}. In time the villagers come to treat you as their local hero. You always receive a place of honour at feasts, and your exploits are told and retold in the pubs and taverns so that the children may keep a memory of you for ever and ever.{***}

str_retirement_text_5|The silver you've saved doesn't last long, but it's enough to buy a small tavern in {s9}. Although the locals are wary of you at first, they soon accept you into their midst. In time your growing tavern becomes a popular feast hall and meeting place. People come for miles to eat or stay there due to your sheer renown and the epic stories you tell of your adventuring days.{***}

str_retirement_text_6|You've saved wisely throughout your career, and now your silver and your intelligence allows you to make some excellent investments to cement your future. After buying several shops and warehouses in {s9}, your shrewdness turns you into one of the most prominent merchants in town, and you soon become a wealthy {man/woman} known as much for your trading empire as your exploits in battle.{***}

str_retirement_text_7|As a landed noble, however minor, your future is all but assured. You settle in your holdfast at {s7}, administrating the village and fields, adjudicating the local courts and fulfilling your obligations to your liege lord. Occasionally your liege calls you to muster and command in his campaigns, but these stints are brief, and you never truly return to the adventuring of your younger days. You have already made your fortune. With your own hall and holdings, you've few wants that your personal wealth and the income of your lands cannot afford you.{***}

str_retirement_text_8|There is no question that you've done very well for yourself. Your extensive holdings and adventuring wealth are enough to guarantee you a rich and easy life for the rest of your days. Retiring to your noble seat in {s8}, you exchange adventure for politics, and you soon establish yourself as a considerable power in your liege lord's kingdom. With intrigue to busy yourself with, your own forests to hunt, a hall to feast in and a hundred fine war stories to tell, you have little trouble making the best of the years that follow.{***}

str_retirement_text_9|As a reward for your competent and loyal service, your liege lord decrees that you be given a hereditary title, joining the major nobility of the realm. Soon you complete your investiture as lord of {s7}, and you become one of your lieges close advisor's and adjutants. Your renown garners you much subtle pull and influence as well as overt political power. Now you spend your days playing the games of power, administering your great fiefs, and recounting the old times of adventure and glory.{***}

str_retirement_text_10|Though you started from humble beginnings, your liege lord holds you in high esteem, and a ripple of shock passes through the realm when he names you to the hereditary title of {duch/duchess} of {s9}. Vast fiefs and fortunes are now yours to rule. You quickly become your lieges most trusted advisor, almost his equal and charged with much of the running of his realm, and you sit upon a throne in your own splendiferous palace as one of the most powerful figures throughout the known world.{***}

str_npc1_intro|Hello, traveller.{***}
str_npc2_intro|Good day. Maybe you would be in need of a sellsword? A bodyguard maybe?{***}
str_npc3_intro|Stay back! What is it you want with me?{***}
str_npc4_intro|Good day. Do you need services of a smith?{***}
str_npc5_intro|Well met, fellow traveller. I am Ser Illifer. Are you looking for an able man to drill your troops?{***}
str_npc6_intro|Hail and well met {ser/madam}.{***}
str_npc7_intro|Good day to you. I'm Qyburn, Maester Qyburn formerly. Mayhaps you need someone to tend to your wounds or ones of your soldiers?{***}
str_npc8_intro|What do you want?{***}
str_npc9_intro|Hey there, looking for information? Knowing everything is my work, tell me what you want t'hear, and Nimble Dick will tell you 'bout it.{***}
str_npc10_intro|Hello. Need a good sailor?{***}
str_npc11_intro|Thieves! Brigands! I'll have their heads for this!{***}
str_npc12_intro|Greetings. I have the honour to be the famous Ser Creighton Longbough, of whom the singers sing!{***}
str_npc13_intro|YOU! You're the one I'm looking for! Fetch me another drink.{***}
str_npc14_intro|Hey there. I see you're a fighter, just like me in some sense. How about some Arbor red?{***}
str_npc15_intro|Greetings, my lord. Are you looking for a young squire by any chance?{***}
str_kurleket_intro|n/a{***}
str_thoros_intro|You seek the Lord of Light, R'hllor?  Then you will find me a poor guide. I am Thoros of Myr.{***}
str_dacey_intro|Hello, {ser/madam}. Is there something you need?{***}
str_wunwun_intro|n/a{***}
str_dongo_intro|n/a{***}

str_1_intro|I am looking for a cowardly group of Dothraki that looted, raped, and murdered the tenants of my father’s fief while under the banner of the Brave Companions. I have already cut down six of them, but they killed my horse, squire, and my father, Ser Garibald Grey the IV, before running away.{***}

str_2_intro|I apologize, I was just dreaming. There is a young squire I love. I dream one day he will become a landed Knight of the Vale and marry me, but to everyone I am a bastard child, I fear it will never happen. Even the first born of a king may have nothing more than a dream.{***}
str_3_intro|I am Ser Shadrich of the Shady Glen and the Mad Mouse, make it quick, I must make it to Dragonstone.{***}
str_4_intro|You got some balls, but I can fix that. Keep your distance or I will geld you like the last two Southerners that laid their hands on me.{***}

str_5_intro|I am Hagan the Beautiful and I am looking for crewmen for my ship. <she looks you over undressing you with her eyes> Aye, you look like you even got some of the equipment only this Captain needs.{***}
str_6_intro|Do you need my services {ser/madam}?  You seem healthy enough, but tell me your symptoms I am sure I can cure you.{***}
str_son_intro|n/a{***}
str_daughter_intro|n/a{***}
str_event_intro|n/a{***}
str_npc1_intro_response_1|Hello, and who have I the pleasure of speaking to?{***}
str_npc2_intro_response_1|Hmm maybe.{***}
str_npc3_intro_response_1|Calm down. I intend you no harm.{***}
str_npc4_intro_response_1|You look troubled, what's wrong?{***}
str_npc5_intro_response_1|What makes you think you are capable of this task?{***}
str_npc6_intro_response_1|Hello ser. Your face looks familiar. Have we met before?{***}
str_npc7_intro_response_1|I didn't know former maesters even existed. What happened to you?{***}
str_npc8_intro_response_1|Merely to pass the time of day, if you're not otherwise engaged.{***}
str_npc9_intro_response_1|I want to know where I can recruit good soldiers. Can you help me?{***}
str_npc10_intro_response_1|Greetings. You look like you're not from these parts. What's your story?{***}
str_npc11_intro_response_1|What troubles you?{***}
str_npc12_intro_response_1|I seek men of skill, not song. Are you one such?{***}
str_npc13_intro_response_1|You've mistook me for an innkeeper. By the Gods, you are huge!{***}
str_npc14_intro_response_1|With pleasure! What's your name? I am {playername}.{***}
str_npc15_intro_response_1|I could be. What's your story?{***}
str_kurleket_intro_response_1|n/a{***}

str_thoros_intro_response_1|The same Thoros of Myr who climbed the walls of Pyke with a flaming sword and the first man into the breach slaughtering Ironmen by the dozen? I could use a warrior such as you.{***}
str_dacey_intro_response_1|My lady, I could not help but notice how comfortable you move in that armour, may I ask your name?{***}
str_wunwun_intro_response_1|n/a.{***}
str_dongo_intro_response_1|n/a{***}
str_1_intro_response_1|Sorry, I have not seen any.{***}
str_2_intro_response_1|You are the daughter of a King?{***}
str_3_intro_response_1|Dragonstone, what’s going on there?{***}
str_4_intro_response_1|Whoa, calm down lady. Do you have a name?{***}
str_5_intro_response_1|Apologies, but aren’t women not allowed to take up arms on the Iron Islands?{***}
str_6_intro_response_1|Forgive me, I was just trying to introduce myself. You are a healer?{***}
str_son_intro_response_1|n/a{***}
str_daughter_intro_response_1|n/a{***}
str_event_intro_response_1|n/a{***}
str_npc1_intro_response_2|Sorry, I'm too busy to talk.{***}
str_npc2_intro_response_2|No, go away.{***}
str_npc3_intro_response_2|OK. Bye, I have work to do.{***}
str_npc4_intro_response_2|You look like trouble, think I'll leave you be.{***}
str_npc5_intro_response_2|You could use some drilling yourself, old man.{***}
str_npc6_intro_response_2|No doubt. Well, good luck getting found.{***}
str_npc7_intro_response_2|I better not deal with the likes of you.{***}
str_npc8_intro_response_2|Nothing at all, from one so clearly disinclined to pleasantries. Good day to you.{***}
str_npc9_intro_response_2|Bugger off, rascal.{***}
str_npc10_intro_response_2|Do I look like a captain of a ship?{***}
str_npc11_intro_response_2|I'll be on my way.{***}
str_npc12_intro_response_2|Where's the honour in that?{***}
str_npc13_intro_response_2|Maybe another time.{***}
str_npc14_intro_response_2|I don't drink with common soldiers.{***}
str_npc15_intro_response_2|Not at this time, no.{***}
str_kurleket_intro_response_2|n/a{***}
str_thoros_intro_response_2|A crazy drunk? I have no time for you.{***}
str_dacey_intro_response_2|Nothing at all.{***}
str_wunwun_intro_response_2|n/a{***}
str_dongo_intro_response_2|n/a{***}
str_1_intro_response_2|I will let you get on with your quest.{***}
str_2_intro_response_2|Obviously you are still dreaming.{***}
str_3_intro_response_2|Then I will not delay you.{***}
str_4_intro_response_2|Obviously, you are just another crazy wildling.{***}
str_5_intro_response_2|Whoa, I think I better leave...{***}
str_6_intro_response_2|Apologies, I thought you were the local whore.{***}
str_son_intro_response_2|n/a{***}
str_daughter_intro_response_2|n/a{***}
str_event_intro_response_2|n/a{***}
str_npc1_backstory_a|Well, {ser/madame}, I am Syrio Forel. I am a swordsman trained in the art of the River Dance.{***}
str_npc2_backstory_a|I sell my services to the highest bidder.{***}
str_npc3_backstory_a|I hope not!{***}
str_npc4_backstory_a|Well, actually maybe you could help me.{***}

str_npc5_backstory_a|Probably due to two things - I am a warrior and I have managed to reach old age. Do you know a lot of old warriors? I can only think of Ser Barristan Selmy, Ser Brynden Tully and myself. I believe that fact is convincing enough.{***}

str_npc6_backstory_a|I am Ser Barristan Selmy, some call me Barristan the Bold. I served Robert in Kingsguard and council. Also served with the Kingslayer and others near as bad, who soiled the white cloak I wore.{***}

str_npc7_backstory_a|Well, I studied at the Citadel and was as skilled in the arts of healing as Maester Ebrose. I sought to surpass him though and did something that the archmaesters considered a terrible crime.{***}
str_npc8_backstory_a|Ah. Well, if you must know, I shall tell you.{***}

str_npc9_backstory_a|Soldiers? Why would you need this lot? In fact, I used t' be a soldier once. Dick Crabb's my name, also called Nimble Dick. You must've heard of me. Fought in many battles, won myself so much glory I have to be discreet 'bout it not to draw too much attention.{***}
str_npc10_backstory_a|Story? Xhondo has no story. Xhondo mates on Cinnamon Wind, trades honestly in Jade Sea, Narrow Sea and Summer Sea.{***}

str_npc11_backstory_a|My name is Hibald. I am a travelling merchant and make my bread on the road. My cart has been recently waylaid by a band of deserters. They took everything save my clothes. I would have fought them but I'm no fighter.{***}

str_npc12_backstory_a|They do not make songs of knights of no repute! Why, I fought valiantly in the Siege of Pyke during the Greyjoy Rebellion. I still remember turning Botley castle and Lordsport to ruins before we launched our attack on Pyke.{***}

str_npc13_backstory_a|Of course I AM huge! You cannot cut down whole armies with little arms like yours! Can you even wield a battleaxe? My name is Shagga son of Dolf. I am leader of the Stone Crows of the Mountains of the Moon.{***}

str_npc14_backstory_a|I'm Anguy. Anguy the Archer. You could've heard my name in King's Landing after I won that archery competition during the Tourney of the Hand. Out shot that Kingsguard knight Ser Balon Swann and Jalabhar Xho, some exiled prince.{***}
str_npc15_backstory_a|Very well my lord. I am Podrick of House Payne.{***}
str_kurleket_backstory_a|n/a{***}

str_thoros_backstory_a|I am good in a scrap, anyone who ever fought me in a tourney can tell you that. While I am a priest of R'hllor my love for the vices of drink, women, and a good fight make certain I'm never too successful in that occupation. However, I still pray and speak the spells of healing taught to me.{***}
str_dacey_backstory_a|I am Dacey Mormont. Daughter of Maege Mormont and the heir to Bear Island.{***}
str_wunwun_backstory_a|n/a{***}
str_dongo_backstory_a|n/a{***}
str_1_backstory_a|I fear the bastards have gotten away. Apologies, my name is Ser Beron of House Grey.{***}
str_2_backstory_a|My father is Robert Baratheon my mother was a mere commoner. While he and Eddard where being fostered by Jon Arryn, Robert took more than a moments pleasure with my mother.{***}

str_3_backstory_a|There is a rumour that Stannis Baratheon intends to march on King’s Landing. While others rush to the clash of arms at tourneys to show fake valour, I prefer to rush towards war and battle.{***}

str_4_backstory_a|I am Val of the Freefolk the sister in-law to Mance Rayder, I am looking for a person who can help us against the White Walkers. You look at me with that crazy stare. That same look all the Southerners give me. I can tell you don't believe me.{***}
str_5_backstory_a|Tell that to Captain Greyjoy, she would laugh at that joke just before she put her suckling babe between your ribs.{***}
str_6_backstory_a|I am an Orphan of the Greenblood, most of us know quite a bit of ancient healing arts of Rhoyne, though I am specifically trained to be a healer.{***}
str_son_backstory_a|n/a{***}
str_daughter_backstory_a|n/a{***}
str_event_backstory_a|n/a{***}
str_npc1_backstory_b|I was once the first sword of Braavos. I can be your personal bodyguard or I can train your peasants and recruits if needed.{***}
str_npc2_backstory_b|Though don't get me mixed up as a friend or a sworn sword, this is strictly business and I do this only for gold.{***}
str_npc3_backstory_b|I've seen your sort before.{***}
str_npc4_backstory_b|I was at Kings Landing when the Starks household were slain. I managed to escape with the Night's Watch but we were ambushed.{***}

str_npc5_backstory_b|I haven't fought in the War of the Ninepenny Kings like Ser Barristan or Ser Brynden but I've had my share of fights and skirmishes. And you've certainly heard that my ancestor destroyed House Lothston of Harrenhal, haven’t you?{***}

str_npc6_backstory_b|I might be serving in King's Landing still if the vile boy upon the Iron Throne had not cast me aside, it shames me to admit. But when he took the cloak the White Bull had draped about my shoulders, and sent men to kill me that selfsame day, it was as though he'd ripped a caul off my eyes.{***}

str_npc7_backstory_b|Instead of opening the bodies of the dead to discover the secrets of the living, I opened the bodies of the still living to discover the secrets of death. When this was discovered, I was stripped from my position as a Maester.{***}
str_npc8_backstory_b|I am a woman wanting to be knight. Unfortunately kin don't see so kindly.{***}

str_npc9_backstory_b|Renowned legendary hero Ser Clarence Crabb used t' be my ancestor. He must've been the one that I inherited swordsmanship from. They say he was so huge and heavy only an aurochs could carry him. I didn't inherit that, though.{***}
str_npc10_backstory_b|Captain Quhuru Mo then says Xhondo is a thief and there is no place for Xhondo on Cinnamon Wind. Xhondo is no thief, but Quhuru Mo is captain.{***}

str_npc11_backstory_b|The constable in these parts is too preoccupied with the war to lift a finger in my defence. And without two coins to rub together I certainly can't scrounge up some sellswords to take back my belongings.{***}

str_npc12_backstory_b|It was a glorious battle! I slew twenty of the Ironborn before taking injury. But for that well struck blow I would have been among the first into the breach of the castle, alongside Thoros of Myr and Jorah Mormont.{***}

str_npc13_backstory_b|Don't stare at me like that or I'll feed your manhood to the goats! Anyway, I wanted another drink. INNKEEP! Hurry with that mead or this inn of yours will lie in ruin before dawn!{***}

str_npc14_backstory_b|Lord Stark offered me to join the Hand's Guard but I know better than to be a guardsman. So he sent me off with the Lightning Lord to execute that giant of an outlaw - The Mountain. Only, after king Robert had died, WE became the outlaws.{***}
str_npc15_backstory_b|I used to squire for a Hedge Knight
column2: Ser Lorimer. My lord was in charge of Tywin Lannister's baggage train, but he ended up stealing food from it. He shared it with me. And, well, it was found out. We were both to be hanged but I was spared because of my family name, and was exiled.{***}

column1: str_kurleket_backstory_b|n/a{***}

str_thoros_backstory_b|I was on a mission to capture Gregor Clegane by Eddard Stark before he was executed for treason. Stuck behind enemy lines I helped found the Brotherhood Without Banners, with Beric Dondarrion trying to protect the small folk from the ravages of war.{***}
str_dacey_backstory_b|I am preparing to join King Robb Starks army for the war against the Lannisters.{***}
str_wunwun_backstory_b|n/a{***}
str_dongo_backstory_b|n/a{***}
str_1_backstory_b|I intend to find the Brotherhood without Banners, to avenge the crimes against House Grey and House Darry.{***}
str_2_backstory_b|Some even claim my conception is what started Robert’s Rebellion.{***}
str_3_backstory_b|As long as the Vale is at peace I have to find worthy work amongst other lords.{***}
str_4_backstory_b|They are real and you better believe that when winter comes, we are all in trouble. That precious wall will not save any king or queen this time.{***}
str_5_backstory_b|I used to be Captain Greyjoy’s helmsman on her flag ship 'Black Wind' then she told me it is time for me to make a name of my own.{***}
str_6_backstory_b|Unfortunately, times are hard, and I need to find work to support my family.{***}
str_son_backstory_b|n/a{***}
str_daughter_backstory_b|n/a{***}
str_event_backstory_b|n/a{***}
str_npc1_backstory_c|I was not chosen as the first sword of Braavos due to strength, speed or youthfulness. But I see while others are blind.{***}
str_npc2_backstory_c|My loyalty lies with whoever has the biggest bag of gold, and it looks like you have plenty in those pockets of yours.{***}
str_npc3_backstory_c|So desperate... willing to do anything...{***}

str_npc4_backstory_c|So here I am, hiding but not knowing where to go. I used to be a blacksmith when back in Kings Landing, maybe I could be of use to you, if you were to keep me safe I could travel with you?{***}

str_npc5_backstory_c|Unfortunately, people tend to judge others by the looks and I look too old to wreak carnage in battles. I do have enough knowledge of arms, riding and tactics to turn a green squire into a seasoned fighter though, don't you doubt it.{***}
str_npc6_backstory_c|That was when I knew I must find my true {king/queen}, and die in {his/her} service.{***}

str_npc7_backstory_c|I then joined The Brave Companions as a means to survive. But in that company of criminals and outcasts I didn't feel safe at all and was constantly uneasy about my life. So I left and had been searching for someone who values the skill but not the title ever since.{***}
str_npc8_backstory_c|Perhaps you're in need of assistance? Following yourself and your companions I could prove myself.{***}

str_npc9_backstory_c|As a matter o' fact, three members o' my House served in the Kingsguard. So if it's an honest and seasoned soldier you're looking for, go no farther. I'm available and you can enlist me right now.{***}
str_npc10_backstory_c|They will not have Xhondo aboard. So Xhondo is left in Oldtown to care for himself in this place Xhondo knows so little about.{***}

str_npc11_backstory_c|When King Robert died so did the King's Peace, it seems. The war is good business, but the risk is too high. Now I have to start from scratch, but with the loans I took up I'm more like to become a dead man.{***}

str_npc12_backstory_c|But even the greatest deeds such as mine fade in time and so I'm travelling around the realm seeking honour and glory. Perhaps you would want Ser Creighton Longbough to add his sword to yours in battles to come?{***}

str_npc13_backstory_c|You're not looking for warriors, are you? I was with the Lannister little lord but guarding his dwarf arse is not for me. I took my pay and my steel battleaxe with me and left. I want to SPILL BLOOD, not stand guard by the door!{***}

str_npc14_backstory_c|We still kept our oath though and remained the King's men. Lord Beric and I, we had different views on justice. I shot brigands and hanged them, he let them have a trial by battle and entrusted their fates to the Red God. In the end, our ways had parted.{***}
str_npc15_backstory_c|So here I am, a young squire looking for a skilled commander to serve.{***}
str_kurleket_backstory_c|n/a{***}
str_thoros_backstory_c|Now I am here, drinking wine whilst deciding what to do next with my sorry life.{***}
str_dacey_backstory_c|Though I would not mind getting a head start and it looks as though you could use an extra pair of hands.{***}
str_wunwun_backstory_c|n/a{***}
str_dongo_backstory_c|n/a{***}
str_1_backstory_c|I don't suppose you have seen the Brotherhood without Banners or know where I can find them?{***}
str_2_backstory_c|Makes no difference really, I dream things that shall never be unless I can find an opportunity to elevate my status.{***}
str_3_backstory_c|Perhaps you would be willing to travel with me?{***}
str_4_backstory_c|We need to spread the word. Get help and convince the Lord Commander to allow free passage for the Free Folk. We are as good as dead staying where we are.{***}
str_5_backstory_c|So here I am, though to be honest, it has been hard to find good recruits. I could use some more stags and maybe a few more battles to really make a name for myself.{***}
str_6_backstory_c|Maybe you are needing someone to help rid your wounded soldiers of infection?{***}
str_son_backstory_c|n/a{***}
str_daughter_backstory_c|n/a{***}
str_event_backstory_c|n/a{***}
str_npc1_backstory_later|Of course. My services are always available.{***}

str_npc2_backstory_later|Aha, decided honour has got you no where? I think you need a man like me by your side. I've been running errands for Tyrion, selling my sword here and there and drinking, aye. So, have you scraped together a fortune to afford my blade?{***}
str_npc3_backstory_later|Here you are again.{***}
str_npc4_backstory_later|I have been applying myself to any work available to make some coin and scrape by. Have you found yourself in need of a good smith?{***}

str_npc5_backstory_later|I have been wandering around the Seven Kingdoms looking for a commander that would value my skill and experience in battle and give me a decent work but I have found none yet. Maybe you are the one?{***}
str_npc6_backstory_later|I have been travelling the Seven Kingdoms honing my skills.{***}
str_npc7_backstory_later|I have been treating the locals with their numerous diseases and somehow managing to scrape along. Perhaps you need my services?{***}
str_npc8_backstory_later|You still in need of a knight in your ranks?{***}
str_npc9_backstory_later|I've been here and 'bout doing all kinds of things. You still need a good sword and a source o' any information?{***}
str_npc10_backstory_later|Xhondo has been looking for work but people only say: ^'Yes-yes, Xhondo. I will come tomorrow.' ^Then people disappear. Will you take Xhondo aboard?{***}

str_npc11_backstory_later|I've been escaping the loan sharks all over the Seven Kingdoms and trying to get by. I haven't yet found anyone interested in my trading expertise. Perhaps you could use a man like me?{***}

str_npc12_backstory_later|I have been looking for opportunities to give the bards and minstrels yet another cause to sing of Ser Creighton Longbough again. Have you come here seeking my valour in battle?{***}

str_npc13_backstory_later|I've been offering my axe to some lords in these parts but they dare laugh in my face! If not for a hundred guards around each of them, I would've cut them all to scraps and fed them to the goats!{***}
str_npc14_backstory_later|I've been earning some dragons by out shooting some confident archers and spending them on whores and wine. Do you perchance need a man deadly with a bow?{***}
str_npc15_backstory_later|I've been fighting in the war for our common liege.{***}
str_kurleket_backstory_later|n/a{***}
str_thoros_backstory_later|The Lord needed my services for a while, now I'm back to roaming taverns drinking wine.{***}
str_dacey_backstory_later|My liege had called the banners since we last spoke. Though some extra experience still wouldn't hurt.{***}
str_wunwun_backstory_later|n/a{***}
str_dongo_backstory_later|n/a{***}
str_1_backstory_later|I have certainly killed more than my share of Lannisters, but vengeance does not feed my family's vassals.{***}
str_2_backstory_later|Nice to see you again, have you changed your mind?{***}
str_3_backstory_later|Perhaps it is time that you decided that you need my sword.{***}
str_4_backstory_later|Perhaps the Old Gods are trying to tell you that you should help my people, with our continued meetings.{***}
str_5_backstory_later|Finding good help is always difficult, my offer still stands.{***}
str_6_backstory_later|Amazing you are still alive. I figured a scratch would become infected and had killed you by now.{***}
str_son_backstory_later|n/a{***}
str_daughter_backstory_later|n/a{***}
str_event_backstory_later|n/a{***}
str_npc1_backstory_response_1|I believe I can afford it. You seem able enough.{***}
str_npc2_backstory_response_1|Well, perhaps I could offer you work. Can you fight?{***}
str_npc3_backstory_response_1|Ummm..{***}
str_npc4_backstory_response_1|Well, maybe you could be useful. But I expect you to pull your weight like every other man in my following.{***}
str_npc5_backstory_response_1|I definitely need such a battle-hardened warrior in my service.{***}
str_npc6_backstory_response_1|Ah, Ser Barristan Selmy. Yes, I've heard much about you. As valiant and honourable as any man. So I've been told.{***}
str_npc7_backstory_response_1|I certainly need a man of your talents in my company.{***}
str_npc8_backstory_response_1|I can offer you opportunities to prove yourself worthy of a female warrior.{***}
str_npc9_backstory_response_1|I'd like to have such a glorious warrior in my host.{***}
str_npc10_backstory_response_1|I do need a skilled sailor to assist me with handling the ship.{***}
str_npc11_backstory_response_1|A man of your talents would be a welcome addition to my host.{***}
str_npc12_backstory_response_1|If you can swing your sword the way you spin tales, I could make use of you.{***}
str_npc13_backstory_response_1|Come with me and you shall bathe in blood.{***}
str_npc14_backstory_response_1|I could really use a man with such an expertise in archery.{***}
str_npc15_backstory_response_1|Well, as it happens, I am looking for someone as yourself in my command.{***}
str_kurleket_backstory_response_1|n/a{***}
str_thoros_backstory_response_1|And what happened to Gregor Clegane, does he still roam the Riverlands doing as he pleases?{***}
str_dacey_backstory_response_1|Well I could certainly use a pair of something and I already have enough hands, if you follow my meaning?{***}
str_wunwun_backstory_response_1|n/a{***}
str_dongo_backstory_response_1|n/a{***}
str_1_backstory_response_1|I have not sorry. Though perhaps you could find a way as a member of my company instead?{***}
str_2_backstory_response_1|I may have just the opportunity for you. How is your sword arm?{***}
str_3_backstory_response_1|I am actually looking for skilled warriors to join me are you interested?{***}
str_4_backstory_response_1|Help against fairy tails and children’s stories. Well, at least you are pretty enough to listen to.{***}
str_5_backstory_response_1|I could possibly use someone with your talents, I could also throw some stags your way for your services.{***}
str_6_backstory_response_1|Funny you should mention it, I am indeed in need of a healer.{***}
str_son_backstory_response_1|n/a{***}
str_daughter_backstory_response_1|n/a{***}
str_event_backstory_response_1|n/a{***}
str_npc1_backstory_response_2|I've no need for you.{***}
str_npc2_backstory_response_2|I know better than to deal with sellswords.{***}
str_npc3_backstory_response_2|OK sling your hook.{***}
str_npc4_backstory_response_2|I don't deal with escaped criminals.{***}
str_npc5_backstory_response_2|I need the young and the strong, not old sorry lot like you.{***}
str_npc6_backstory_response_2|Well, if you were no good for that boy King then you are certainly no good for me. Good day.{***}
str_npc7_backstory_response_2|By the Gods, you're a necromancer! Stay away from me!{***}
str_npc8_backstory_response_2|Well, good luck.{***}
str_npc9_backstory_response_2|Tell your tales to some tavern wench.{***}
str_npc10_backstory_response_2|Xhondo can keep searching. I have no need of a sailor.{***}
str_npc11_backstory_response_2|I've no need for a merchant at this time.{***}
str_npc12_backstory_response_2|If you care so much for songs, become a bard. I will look elsewhere for warriors.{***}
str_npc13_backstory_response_2|Another time, Shaggy.{***}
str_npc14_backstory_response_2|I shall tell the guardsmen about you, criminal.{***}
str_npc15_backstory_response_2|Good luck finding him.{***}
str_kurleket_backstory_response_2|n/a{***}
str_thoros_backstory_response_2|I have no need for a priest or a drunk! Goodbye.{***}
str_dacey_backstory_response_2|I have no time to look after women that may get hurt.{***}
str_wunwun_backstory_response_2|n/a{***}
str_dongo_backstory_response_2|n/a{***}
str_1_backstory_response_2|Nope, but good luck on your search.{***}
str_2_backstory_response_2|I wish you good luck.{***}
str_3_backstory_response_2|Farewell and good luck.{***}
str_4_backstory_response_2|Help against fairy tails and children’s stories. No thanks.{***}
str_5_backstory_response_2|I should probably just leave you to your business.{***}
str_6_backstory_response_2|You should go back home.{***}
str_son_backstory_response_2|n/a{***}
str_daughter_backstory_response_2|n/a{***}
str_event_backstory_response_2|n/a{***}
str_npc1_signup|{Ser/Madame} -- I will serve you with honour.{***}
str_npc2_signup|Of course I can fight, perhaps you would like a demonstration? I could rip your heart out while you stand.{***}
str_npc3_signup|So you want my help, eh?{***}
str_npc4_signup|Sure, I can fight too if needed. I wont let you down.{***}

str_npc5_signup|Excellent. Finally my search has come to an end and I can devote myself to what I'm best at - drilling troops. You won't have to look after me on the field, I will handle myself well enough since the Warrior rides with me in battles.{***}
str_npc6_signup|If you would have me join your service I would be glad to assist you while I find who it is I am looking for.{***}
str_npc7_signup|Thank you, Sire. I am able to treat any wound and cure any known poison. My knowledge of healing arts will save a lot of soldiers that follow you into battles.{***}
str_npc8_signup|Then I shall accept your offer. But, believe me, I will prove myself to be the best warrior in your ranks. {***}
str_npc9_signup|And you're right in that will o' yours! I can also find trails in different areas that would otherwise remain unseen to you and your party.{***}
str_npc10_signup|Xhondo will serve well. Xhondo knows many tongues, a little. And how to use a blade.{***}

str_npc11_signup|You'll find few merchants as skilled in the art of trade as I am. I've bought priceless works of art for pennies and sold junk for castles. I can point out the best deals, haggle down prices and help organize your finances.{***}

str_npc12_signup|I spin nothing for I am a knight, not a tailor! I assure you that when swords clash, you shall never find me in the rear. Should the day come that I lose my life in battle, my foes will be piled all around me!{***}
str_npc13_signup|Just point me at your enemies and I will cleave through them. Shagga son of Dolf never fails and never falls.{***}

str_npc14_signup|There's no finer archer than me in the Seven Kingdoms. Ensure that I am stationed on some solid ground and I'll rain down death on your enemies. I am also a skilled spotter and tracker.{***}
str_npc15_signup|You do? Well, I am very fortunate to have come across you today!{***}
str_kurleket_signup|n/a{***}
str_thoros_signup|That is now none of my concern, what with the good Eddard Stark having no head un'all.{***}
str_dacey_signup|Lucky for you I shall ignore that comment, though next time you shall not be so courteous.{***}
str_wunwun_signup|n/a{***}
str_dongo_signup|n/a{***}
str_1_signup|I would gladly serve you, if only to do a single good deed.{***}
str_2_signup|My sword arm is just fine, I am used to fighting off a Stone Crow or two taking people to the Eyrie.{***}
str_3_signup|Firstly, I should ask you not to run from a battle, win or lose, every battle offers a man a chance to win glory.{***}
str_4_signup|I did not cross the wall to tell stories. If I can’t persuade people to help, we will all be dead when winter comes.{***}
str_5_signup|I guess I could be willing to work for someone like you.{***}
str_6_signup|I would be happy to serve you.{***}
str_son_signup|n/a{***}
str_daughter_signup|n/a{***}
str_event_signup|n/a{***}
str_npc1_signup_2|Your soldiers will be all the better for me joining you, hopefully you may even live a little while longer.{***}
str_npc2_signup_2|The better you pay the better I fight.{***}
str_npc3_signup_2|Very well.{***}
str_npc4_signup_2|Though I trust you wont turn me in the first sign of trouble?{***}

str_npc5_signup_2|There are two conditions of my service, though. Do not flee from battles and do not pay off brigands to gain passage through the land. Otherwise all my work will be undone in the blink of an eye, soldiers don't serve under cravens.{***}
str_npc6_signup_2|I've heard rumours of a Targaryen girl across the narrow sea gathering an army. Maybe that's where we should be headed.{***}

str_npc7_signup_2|I want to point out though that since I will tend to your soldiers and they are an awful lot even in good mood, you should not let them starve, cut down their pay or allow them to be butchered on the field of battle.{***}
str_npc8_signup_2|I shall be pleased to fight in your shield-wall. But I warn you -- if you ask me to gather the firewood, or cook a meal, you will not like the consequences.{***}

str_npc9_signup_2|I know as well where t' look after battle's done for things o' most value. Therefore I ask that you don't leave Ol' Dick without my share of loot and a tasty chunk of meat by the fire.{***}
str_npc10_signup_2|Xhondo wants his belly full with food and drinks and his pockets ringing with coins. Or Xhondo will be much displeased.{***}

str_npc11_signup_2|It'll be good to chase after the bandits rather than run from them for once. But I am a merchant first of all and you should know that it would ruin my name were I to be associated with a band of raiders and looters.{***}

str_npc12_signup_2|No doubt some lord will seek out my service in the near future, but I hear you are bound for great perils. You shall definitely have need of my steel, and the arm that wields it! I ask only that we do not flee from the field of battle, there is no honour in that.{***}

str_npc13_signup_2|Just make sure there's always enough food and coin to supply my needs. No man can fight with a hunger in his belly and no good warrior can skip a good feast after the battle is won!{***}

str_npc14_signup_2|It feels great to take up arms again. You won't find me generous with brigands we will encounter, if you get the meaning. And keep in mind that I won't tolerate robbing peasants and burning down villages.{***}
str_npc15_signup_2|I will not let you down. I think you will find me a valuable addition to your ranks. I will serve you faithfully, my lord.{***}
str_kurleket_signup_2|n/a{***}

str_thoros_signup_2|So I guess it’s either live as an outlaw bringing justice to those who think they are above it, or joining someone such as yourself to make the world a better place.  I warn you though do not prey on the weak or defenceless and I value your men’s lives and although I may be able to resurrect some of our dead with the Last Kiss, the flames of life consume and they will never be the same.{***}
str_dacey_signup_2|Should I join you, I shall need to get some provisions and send a raven to Winterfell to tell them I may be delayed.{***}
str_wunwun_signup_2|n/a{***}
str_dongo_signup_2|n/a{***}
str_1_signup_2|I may not be able to get revenge for my family’s tenants, but if you pay me enough stags, I could ensure they can buy enough supplies to get them back on their feet.{***}
str_2_signup_2|I will need some equipment before we leave though.{***}
str_3_signup_2|Only then I will pledge you my blade.{***}
str_4_signup_2|So, are you willing to help or am I wasting my time here?{***}
str_5_signup_2|Just don’t be a pussy and run from battles, I need the fame.{***}
str_6_signup_2|But first let me tell you this, my skills are far above those of a Maester’s. Not only can I heal the wounded, I can tend to some of the most gruesome wounds and prevent scaring.{***}
str_son_signup_2|n/a{***}
str_daughter_signup_2|n/a{***}
str_event_signup_2|n/a{***}
str_npc1_signup_response_1|Well, it seems you could be useful to us.{***}
str_npc2_signup_response_1|You can prove your prowess in battle.{***}
str_npc3_signup_response_1|I.. OK.{***}
str_npc4_signup_response_1|Of course not, I'm loyal to my men and you have my word Gendry.{***}
str_npc5_signup_response_1|You have my word that my command meets your conditions.{***}
str_npc6_signup_response_1|I'm sure a man of your stature could become very useful on our travels.{***}
str_npc7_signup_response_1|I am a reasonable strategist and won't allow that to happen.{***}
str_npc8_signup_response_1|No fear, friend. You're a warrior, and you'll be treated accordingly.{***}
str_npc9_signup_response_1|Why would I deceive such an honest man?{***}
str_npc10_signup_response_1|We have plenty of food and coin for everyone. Welcome to our party.{***}
str_npc11_signup_response_1|I understand, and rest assured your worries are unfounded with me.{***}
str_npc12_signup_response_1|I never run from battles - I seek them.{***}
str_npc13_signup_response_1|There's never a shortage of food and coin in my camp. We shall feast on our victories!{***}
str_npc14_signup_response_1|I share your views. Let us clear the land from this rabble together.{***}
str_npc15_signup_response_1|Good! Get your stuff ready, and meet me outside.{***}
str_kurleket_signup_response_1|n/a{***}
str_thoros_signup_response_1|It is a reasonable request, I will try my best to honour them. Though war does make some men monsters.{***}
str_dacey_signup_response_1|Very well, I could always use a she-bear from the Bear Islands.{***}
str_wunwun_signup_response_1|n/a{***}
str_dongo_signup_response_1|n/a{***}
str_1_signup_response_1|How many stags do you require?{***}
str_2_signup_response_1|Ok but hurry along we leave soon.{***}
str_3_signup_response_1|I share your sentiments friend. I fight every battle to last of my dyeing breath.{***}
str_4_signup_response_1|OK. Perhaps we could help each other, I need a persuasive envoy.{***}
str_5_signup_response_1|I think I can honour that deal.{***}
str_6_signup_response_1|Good! Get your stuff ready, and meet me outside.{***}
str_son_signup_response_1|n/a{***}
str_daughter_signup_response_1|n/a{***}
str_event_signup_response_1|n/a{***}
str_npc1_signup_response_2|Hmm, I'm too busy for this. Good day, ser.{***}
str_npc2_signup_response_2|I'm afraid you are not who I'm looking for.{***}
str_npc3_signup_response_2|Actually no, I think you are pretty useless.{***}
str_npc4_signup_response_2|On second thoughts, maybe its not such a good idea having you hanging around with us drawing unwanted attention.{***}
str_npc5_signup_response_2|Too much fuss over some old grumbler.{***}
str_npc6_signup_response_2|Actually, I've changed my mind. Your honour stinks like shit and I don't like it.{***}
str_npc7_signup_response_2|These are my people and I do as I please with them!{***}
str_npc8_signup_response_2|Ah. Actually, maybe I don't need a woman trying to be a knight riding with me.{***}
str_npc9_signup_response_2|You would rob even the beggars, it seems. Be gone.{***}
str_npc10_signup_response_2|Another mouth! No food for Xhondo.{***}
str_npc11_signup_response_2|I do as I please, if you don't like it then stay here.{***}
str_npc12_signup_response_2|An over-weight, over-confident hedge knight will only slow me down.{***}
str_npc13_signup_response_2|You'll devour my food inventories!{***}
str_npc14_signup_response_2|I deal with low-born as I please.{***}
str_npc15_signup_response_2|On second thought, wars might be too dangerous for you. Sorry lad.{***}
str_kurleket_signup_response_2|n/a{***}
str_thoros_signup_response_2|Then you should be an outlaw.{***}
str_dacey_signup_response_2|In fact, your actually pretty scary, maybe I wont be needing you.{***}
str_wunwun_signup_response_2|n/a{***}
str_dongo_signup_response_2|n/a{***}
str_1_signup_response_2|I have no room for some goodie-two shoes.{***}
str_2_signup_response_2|On second thought, you are just a girl.{***}
str_3_signup_response_2|In fact, I have changed my mind.{***}
str_4_signup_response_2|I have no time for a delusional woman no matter how beautiful she is.{***}
str_5_signup_response_2|I wish you luck.{***}
str_6_signup_response_2|Sorry, but I am not interested.{***}
str_son_signup_response_2|n/a{***}
str_daughter_signup_response_2|n/a{***}
str_event_signup_response_2|n/a{***}
str_npc1_payment|I will be very useful to you, {ser/madame}, you can count on that. Though I will require {reg3} silver stags for my services. One must still earn a living.{***}
str_npc2_payment|Before I sign up, I will need {reg3} stags. But don't go looking for me to bend the knee and m'lord you every time you take a shit. I'm not your toady and I'm not your friend.{***}
str_npc3_payment|Though before I join you, I will need {reg3} coins, sharply.{***}

str_npc4_payment|I hope so. I do have one more favour though. I lost all my stags in the ambush and need to square up with the tavern keeper here in {s20}. Could you please lend me {reg3} silver stags?{***}
str_npc5_payment|Tremendous! One last thing. I require a sum of {reg3} stags before I join you. A proper soldier never enters someone's service without receiving enlistment payment first.{***}
str_npc6_payment|Sure, though I shall require {reg3} coins as payment.{***}
str_npc7_payment|That is reassuring. Before we venture on, however, I need to buy certain herbs and potions that by my estimate are worth {reg3} stags.{***}
str_npc8_payment|Then I will fight with you your enemies. But first I'm in need of {reg3} silver stags.{***}
str_npc9_payment|That's what I'm always sayin'! Anyway, an honest soldier such as me requires an honest payment before he starts fighting. All I ask is a humble sum of {reg3} stags.{***}
str_npc10_payment|Good. Xhondo has no money and asks for {reg3} stags. Now.{***}

str_npc11_payment|Thank you, you won't regret taking me along. However, there is the matter of the loans I took up. I acquired {reg3} stags for my last shipment. I cannot travel openly unless I repay the loans.{***}

str_npc12_payment|Truer words were never spoken! Now there's a small matter of payment left, I'll need {reg3} stags to pay local smith for the repair of my blade. I had notched it in a furious struggle with bandits in the countryside, you see. Plus a little for myself, of course.{***}
str_npc13_payment|I need {reg3} stags to pay for all the mead I've drunk and meat I've feasted on over these days.{***}

str_npc14_payment|Aye. There's just this one thing before we go on. I've spent last night with some expensive whores that seems to have left me broke. I require {reg3} stags to supply my need for fine wine and ladies.{***}
str_npc15_payment|I do however require {reg3} stags. I may have overspent a little, staying here far too long.{***}
str_kurleket_payment|n/a{***}
str_thoros_payment|That it does, hopefully we can escape the transformation that strikes down others. Before we leave though, I need you to take care of my tab, I warn you, it is a hefty one.{***}
str_dacey_payment|Very well, I shall need to see the master and I expect you will pay the {reg3} coins for his services and my stay here?{***}
str_wunwun_payment|n/a{***}
str_dongo_payment|n/a{***}
str_1_payment|{reg3} should be enough. A hefty sum I know but nothing is cheap whilst the war still rages.{***}
str_2_payment|I will need {reg3} stags. You know, for my equipment.{***}
str_3_payment|I ask you pay me {reg3} stags upfront, this will cover my living should you die while I am in your employ, I do not want to be a poor knight.{***}

str_4_payment|I can be your envoy but first you must promise to raise an army to help my people and to pay me {reg3} stags as a show of your good faith so I may purchase some weapons for my people.{***}
str_5_payment|How does {reg3} stags, and a weekly wage sound?{***}
str_6_payment| I will not come cheap though, I require 9000 stags up front and a weekly wage.{***}
str_son_payment|n/a{***}
str_daughter_payment|n/a{***}
str_event_payment|n/a{***}
str_npc1_payment_response|Very well, here's {reg3} silver stags.{***}
str_npc2_payment_response|Very well.{***}
str_npc3_payment_response|I wont ask... Here you go.{***}
str_npc4_payment_response|Take your {reg3} stags and be quick. We're marching soon.{***}
str_npc5_payment_response|No objections on this. Here's your {reg3} stags.{***}
str_npc6_payment_response|OK, ill pay them for you.{***}
str_npc7_payment_response|Of course! Here, take {reg3} stags and purchase what you need. Meet me outside afterwards.{***}
str_npc8_payment_response|Hmm OK, here's {reg3} silver stags for you.{***}
str_npc9_payment_response|Honest words from such a... seasoned soldier. Here's your {reg3} stags.{***}
str_npc10_payment_response|Fair enough. Here's {reg3} stags. Meet me outside.{***}
str_npc11_payment_response|Here is the money, {reg3} stags, see to the loans and try to come back with all your limbs.{***}
str_npc12_payment_response|The sword doesn't make the man, but take your {reg3} stags and meet me outside.{***}
str_npc13_payment_response|You certainly like to eat, Shagga. Here's {reg3} stags.{***}
str_npc14_payment_response|Here. Take {reg3} stags and make ready to leave soon.{***}
str_npc15_payment_response|Fair enough. Here's {reg3} stags, as you requested. Now get ready to move out.{***}
str_kurleket_payment_response|n/a{***}
str_thoros_payment_response|Seven hells! How much wine have you drank?! Here's your {reg3} stags.{***}
str_dacey_payment_response|Sure, here's your {reg3} stags.{***}
str_wunwun_payment_response|n/a{***}
str_dongo_payment_response|n/a{***}
str_1_payment_response|Then {reg3} stags for a knightly deed.{***}
str_2_payment_response|Yes yes, here's your {reg3} stags.{***}
str_3_payment_response|Very well Ser Shadrich, grab your gear we are leaving.{***}
str_4_payment_response|That’s a fair deal.{***}
str_5_payment_response|A fair price. Welcome aboard.{***}
str_6_payment_response|You better be worth your 9000 stags.{***}
str_son_payment_response|n/a{***}
str_daughter_payment_response|n/a{***}
str_event_payment_response|n/a{***}
str_npc1_morality_speech|It's a bit much that we {s21}. You should take a little more care in the future, if you don't mind my saying.{***}
str_npc2_morality_speech|Its not always good to {s21}. Though it does make us richer.{***}
str_npc3_morality_speech|I confess that I am somewhat shocked that we {s21}.{***}
str_npc4_morality_speech|What we did back there wasn't right, Commander. I know war isn't what the bards make of it in songs but we shouldn't just {s21}.{***}
str_npc5_morality_speech|Commander, if your preference is to {s21}, then my drilling of your soldiers is going to pot. And Mother have mercy on you when you finally decide to fight.{***}
str_npc6_morality_speech|Excuse me, {ser/madame}. As you know, I joined with you to right wrongs, restore my own honour. I did not expect to {s21}.{***}
str_npc7_morality_speech|Sire, it is utterly disappointing when you {s21}. I will not remain for long in a company with such leadership.{***}
str_npc8_morality_speech|I was not pleased that you decided to {s21}. To fall in battle is an honour, but to fight along side a coward is a disgrace.{***}
str_npc9_morality_speech|Commander, if you {s21} why are you at the head of our army? Ol' Dick has some experience in leading troops, I can do that in your stead.{***}
str_npc10_morality_speech|Captain, you {s21}. Xhondo is not pleased.{***}
str_npc11_morality_speech|I was quite clear about the conditions of my service. If you wish to {s21} to acquire your coin then you shall have to spend it without my guidance.{***}
str_npc12_morality_speech|Commander, if you oft {s21}, your men including me might start thinking that they would be better off serving another lord or even on their own.{***}
str_npc13_morality_speech|Chief, Shagga is not going to sit idly by while you {s21}. Lead us the way it should be done or stand down and let true warriors do this!{***}
str_npc14_morality_speech|Captain, what made you {s21}? It is not what I expected of you. If you think I will waylay caravans and butcher innocents you are gravely mistaken.{***}
str_npc15_morality_speech|My lord, I don't think I can watch you murder the poor innocent souls. Please reconsider next time before doing such an action.{***}
str_kurleket_morality_speech|Should we really {s21}?{***}

str_thoros_morality_speech|Look at how many men I am going to have to kiss to get things back to normal around here. I should of stayed at the tavern you found me in, at least then I could count on kissing at least one wicked woman.{***}
str_dacey_morality_speech|I would not be running from a battle if I was with King Robb Stark. Just remember, I chose you as my commander, but I can always change my mind.{***}
str_wunwun_morality_speech|Captain, what made you {s21}? It is not what I expected of you. If you think I will waylay caravans and butcher innocents you are gravely mistaken.{***}
str_dongo_morality_speech|My lord, I don't think I can watch you murder the poor innocent souls. Please reconsider next time before doing such an action.{***}
str_1_morality_speech|My Lord, I am a knight, not a cowardly butcher! Discharge me from my oath to you or quit hurting those we should defend.{***}
str_2_morality_speech|If this is how you keep your promises, then I have no hope of reaching my dream.{***}
str_3_morality_speech|Your common mouse will run from blood and battle. The mad mouse seeks them out!{***}
str_4_morality_speech|You made a promise to me as well, is this what I can expect of your promises?{***}
str_5_morality_speech|Just one word for you my lord….Pussy{***}
str_6_morality_speech|You need to find yourself a grave digger not a healer. This careless disregard for life must end if I am to stay under your command!{***}
str_son_morality_speech|{Father/Mother}. Should we really {s21}?{***}
str_daughter_morality_speech|{Father/Mother}. Should we really {s21}?{***}
str_event_morality_speech|Should we really {s21}?{***}
str_npc1_2ary_morality_speech|Next time we should not {s21}. The first sword of Braavos does not approve.{***}
str_npc2_2ary_morality_speech|Needs must. If we have to {s21} then so be it. Doing what's right will mostly always only get a man killed{***}
str_npc3_2ary_morality_speech|I think it was the correct decision you took to {s21}. There is no shame in finding a way to avoid the spilling of blood.{***}
str_npc4_2ary_morality_speech|Its not good to {s21}.{***}
str_npc5_2ary_morality_speech|Why is it you choose to {s21}.{***}
str_npc6_2ary_morality_speech|{Ser/Madame} - you may choose to {s21}, but I would prefer to have no part in it.{***}
str_npc7_2ary_morality_speech|Why is it you choose to {s21}.{***}
str_npc8_2ary_morality_speech|I think it was a brave decision you took to {s21}. There is no shame in finding a way to avoid the spilling of blood.{***}
str_npc9_2ary_morality_speech|Why is it you choose to {s21}.{***}
str_npc10_2ary_morality_speech|Why is it you choose to {s21}.{***}
str_npc11_2ary_morality_speech|Why is it you choose to {s21}.{***}
str_npc12_2ary_morality_speech|Why is it you choose to {s21}.{***}
str_npc13_2ary_morality_speech|Why is it you choose to {s21}.{***}
str_npc14_2ary_morality_speech|Why is it you choose to {s21}.{***}
str_npc15_2ary_morality_speech|Why is it you choose to {s21}.{***}
str_kurleket_2ary_morality_speech|Why is it you choose to {s21}.{***}
str_thoros_2ary_morality_speech|Justice. I remember justice. It had a pleasant taste.{***}
str_dacey_2ary_morality_speech|I would not be running from a battle if I was with King Robb Stark. Just remember, I chose you as my commander, but I can always change my mind{***}
str_wunwun_2ary_morality_speech|Why is it you choose to {s21}.{***}
str_dongo_2ary_morality_speech|Why is it you choose to {s21}.{***}
str_1_2ary_morality_speech|Why is it you choose to {s21}.{***}
str_2_2ary_morality_speech|Why is it you choose to {s21}.{***}
str_3_2ary_morality_speech|Why is it you choose to {s21}.{***}
str_4_2ary_morality_speech|Why is it you choose to {s21}.{***}
str_5_2ary_morality_speech|Why is it you choose to {s21}.{***}
str_6_2ary_morality_speech|{Ser/Madame} - you may choose to {s21}, but I would prefer to have no part in it.{***}
str_son_2ary_morality_speech|{Father/Mother}. Why is it you choose to {s21}.{***}
str_daughter_2ary_morality_speech|{Father/Mother}. Why is it you choose to {s21}.{***}
str_event_2ary_morality_speech|Why is it you choose to {s21}.{***}
str_npc1_personalityclash_speech|..{***}
str_npc2_personalityclash_speech|I have no loyalties here, the sooner people realised that the better we all will be.{***}
str_npc3_personalityclash_speech|In my opinion, {s11} is terrible.. I cant say why.. I cant say when.. But I do know you know.{***}

str_npc4_personalityclash_speech|Commander, that merchant {s11} is a weak and slippery man. Always trying to pay men to do his work for him, never able to dirty his dainty hands with anything but counting coppers.{***}

str_npc5_personalityclash_speech|Commander, I do understand that you need able soldiers but {s11} is worst of all the sellsword scum in the realm. He's a godless man without any honour or dignity.{***}
str_npc6_personalityclash_speech|{s11}'s barbaric! I can put an end to him if you will?{***}

str_npc7_personalityclash_speech|Sire, I've come to you to talk about {s11}. He considers himself a wise and learned man yet he sees my experiments of purely scientific interest a threat to himself and our company.{***}
str_npc8_personalityclash_speech|Their is something wrong with that man!{***}

str_npc9_personalityclash_speech|Commander, this old fool {s11} thinks himself so experienced a warrior and so valiant a knight yet he has refused to get down from that horse o' his and give me, a 'simple sellsword', a hand when I needed one.{***}
str_npc10_personalityclash_speech|Captain, Xhondo knows he is not local. Xhondo tries to mate with your crew but {s11} always makes mock of Xhondo.{***}

str_npc11_personalityclash_speech|Leader, I have seen a thing or two in my life and not all of them quite pleasant. But that old man calling himself a former maester known as {s11} is the most fearful creature I've laid my eyes upon.{***}
str_npc12_personalityclash_speech|Commander, {s11} has to be the most uncouth lout I have ever had the displeasure to meet! He reeks of ale and sweat so badly that it keeps me up at night.{***}
str_npc13_personalityclash_speech|Chief, I don't like {s11} at all. He does things forbidden by the Old Gods and can call down their wrath upon us.{***}
str_npc14_personalityclash_speech|Captain, {s11} is just another of those brigands of which I've seen and slain hundreds. Sometimes I think what prevents me from making a few holes in him.{***}
str_npc15_personalityclash_speech|..{***}
str_kurleket_personalityclash_speech|...{***}
str_thoros_personalityclash_speech|That jackal Qyburn served with the Brave Companions, they burned crops, maimed, tortured, raped, and murdered for nothing more that sport.{***}
str_dacey_personalityclash_speech|You would think my uncle Jeor could have at least killed this one before he got over the wall. Crastos is unworthy to serve you{***}
str_wunwun_personalityclash_speech|Wun-Wun smash!{***}
str_dongo_personalityclash_speech|Dongo don't like little human.{***}
str_1_personalityclash_speech|The only Red Chicken Knight he ever fought was in a pot.{***}
str_2_personalityclash_speech|The only thing different from Crastos and a Stone Crow is the smell, at least a Stone Crow bathes.{***}
str_3_personalityclash_speech|The reason Hibald is always out of breath after a battle is because he ran from it.{***}
str_4_personalityclash_speech|If Hibald so much as looks at me again, he will be singing a bit higher by the campfire tonight after I cut off his nuts.{***}
str_5_personalityclash_speech|How can you get the name Dick when you come up short?{***}

str_6_personalityclash_speech|Ser Shadrich is perhaps the cruellest of your knights, he seeks only to kill and maim his adversaries, wounds inflicted by him are always lethal and beyond my skill.{***}
str_son_personalityclash_speech|...{***}
str_daughter_personalityclash_speech|...{***}
str_event_personalityclash_speech|...{***}
str_npc1_personalityclash_speech_b|A sword of Braavos expects more from a man.{***}
str_npc2_personalityclash_speech_b|He thinks he shits gold! He's no better than any other man.{***}
str_npc3_personalityclash_speech_b|This man, that man, her man, your man. Who cares? Hahahaha.{***}
str_npc4_personalityclash_speech_b|He always stays out of fighting yet he mocks me and makes fun of my way of fighting. Can we get rid of this venal creature as soon as possible?{***}

str_npc5_personalityclash_speech_b|When I told him that Seven would sort him out for all the terrible things he had done he only laughed to my face and called me an old Septon. I am a godly man, but I am also a knight and won't tolerate such blasphemy!{***}
str_npc6_personalityclash_speech_b|I am sure no one will miss him.{***}

str_npc7_personalityclash_speech_b|What can a merchant know about Maesters work? I don't interrupt him while he's haggling at the market yet he deems appropriate to disturb me in the middle of my experiments.{***}
str_npc8_personalityclash_speech_b|He thinks of women as his trophy's. He thinks to lay a hand on me and ill have him.{***}
str_npc9_personalityclash_speech_b|I understand his ass is too noble and pious to be seated near mine but he could assist me when I was knocked down by a couple of enemy horsemen nonetheless.{***}
str_npc10_personalityclash_speech_b|Xhondo is not cruel but sometimes Xhondo wants to bash the head of that jester. Xhondo wants his ship to sail.{***}

str_npc11_personalityclash_speech_b|I have never heard of a Maester losing his chains. That Qyburn must have done something very wrong to get tossed out of his order. Word is that he was caught practising the dark arts and unspeakable horrors. I do not want that man around me when I am injured and unable to fend for myself!{***}

str_npc12_personalityclash_speech_b|And when he's not devouring our stock of food he is going through our stores of ale like if he was dying of thirst. I swear it's like the King's Name day at the Quill and Tankard everyday with him!{***}
str_npc13_personalityclash_speech_b|Let me cut off his manhood and feed it to the goats and then give his neck a tickle with my battleaxe!{***}
str_npc14_personalityclash_speech_b|Moreover, he's a despicable pillager and would probably search his own dead parents for a coin. Give me leave to deal with this scum.{***}
str_npc15_personalityclash_speech_b|...{***}
str_kurleket_personalityclash_speech_b|...{***}
str_thoros_personalityclash_speech_b|If we pass a tall tree we should hang him, and I will make especially sure I pray to the Lord of Light to roast his soul to the end of time.{***}
str_dacey_personalityclash_speech_b|We should send him back where he belongs!{***}
str_wunwun_personalityclash_speech_b|Smash!!{***}
str_dongo_personalityclash_speech_b|Maybe Dongo wipe smile off humans face.{***}
str_1_personalityclash_speech_b|He is a disgrace to all knights and even fat slobs.{***}
str_2_personalityclash_speech_b|He makes no sense, always talking in riddles. I think he had a knock to the head when a small boy.{***}
str_3_personalityclash_speech_b|We have no need for traders of auroch shit on a battlefield.{***}
str_4_personalityclash_speech_b|Maybe I will fry them up whilst he watches.{***}
str_5_personalityclash_speech_b|What a sorry excuse of a man.{***}
str_6_personalityclash_speech_b|We should ditch him at the next battlefield.{***}
str_son_personalityclash_speech_b|...{***}
str_daughter_personalityclash_speech_b|...{***}
str_event_personalityclash_speech_b|...{***}
str_npc1_personalityclash2_speech|I grow tired of {s11} and his Red God.{***}

str_npc2_personalityclash2_speech|Captain, are we recruiting all kinds of Septons and fanatics now? {s11} is only capable of praying and preaching, what makes him a good fodder but not a bit a warrior we could use.{***}
str_npc3_personalityclash2_speech|That Syrio speaks funny.{***}

str_npc4_personalityclash2_speech|Commander, that huge sailor of yours, {s11}, is a brute and a stranger to our realm. Last time we fought shoulder to shoulder he roared something incomprehensible in his own tongue and cut off man's head.{***}

str_npc5_personalityclash2_speech|Commander, {s11} is intolerable. He considers himself a great warrior from House Crabb yet he's no more than some common brigand. In the last fight I rushed to help him against two brutes and he stepped out and left me to fend for myself.{***}
str_npc6_personalityclash2_speech|....{***}

str_npc7_personalityclash2_speech|Sire, enlisting barbarians and all kinds of hairy creatures able to fight can prove to be a grievous mistake. How do you plan to actually control that beast of a man {s11}?{***}
str_npc8_personalityclash2_speech|He calls himself a knight.. Pah!{***}

str_npc9_personalityclash2_speech|Commander, this young archer {s11} you've taken along sometimes looks at me as if I've burned down his home and murdered his family. I swear, he's like to cut my throat in my sleep.{***}
str_npc10_personalityclash2_speech|Captain, last battle Xhondo had this boy {s11} behind his back. Xhondo was attacked by group of foes and knew he was not alone.{***}

str_npc11_personalityclash2_speech|Leader, this smith boy {s11} is too naive and simple-minded to remain in our war party. He can neither fight well, nor loot the scum we're leaving behind us. And those vaunted smithing skills of his. Did he craft you anything yet?{***}

str_npc12_personalityclash2_speech|Commander, {s11} has to be the most dangerous person I have ever met. There may be better swordsmen and fighters out there, but they normally get slowed down by things like honour and mercy. Bronn, on the other hand, would probably kill a babe if he was paid well enough.{***}

str_npc13_personalityclash2_speech|Chief, blabbering wenches shouldn't be part of our warband. {s11} is always talking about his prowess but in the last battle he almost broke his toe running from the enemies.{***}
str_npc14_personalityclash2_speech|Captain, what use is this huge {s11} if he doesn't speak Common Tongue and doesn't even understand the japes me and the other soldiers make?{***}
str_npc15_personalityclash2_speech|none.{***}
str_kurleket_personalityclash2_speech|...{***}
str_thoros_personalityclash2_speech|...{***}
str_dacey_personalityclash2_speech|...{***}
str_wunwun_personalityclash2_speech|n/a{***}
str_dongo_personalityclash2_speech|none.{***}
str_1_personalityclash2_speech|Qyburn is one of those who killed, raped, tortured my people, and burned my home. A treacherous bastard.{***}
str_2_personalityclash2_speech|Nothing more than a bully, a brute that preys on the weak.{***}
str_3_personalityclash2_speech|The wench of Tarth had the nerve to call me short before the last battle.{***}
str_4_personalityclash2_speech|That Ser Illfer could not even train the tavern drunk to drink a glass of ale.{***}
str_5_personalityclash2_speech|Xhondu is a poor excuse for a sailor and a warrior, he would not survive an hour on the Black Wind.{***}
str_6_personalityclash2_speech|Qyburn is no healer, but a cruel torturer who enjoys turning everyone around him into an experiment.{***}
str_son_personalityclash2_speech|...{***}
str_daughter_personalityclash2_speech|...{***}
str_event_personalityclash2_speech|...{***}
str_npc1_personalityclash2_speech_b|Their is only one God, and his name is death.{***}

str_npc2_personalityclash2_speech_b|He even tried to talk to me about his religion after last battle, that old begging brother! I say rid us of him and let him pray to his Seven in some shit hole sept along the road. {***}
str_npc3_personalityclash2_speech_b|After our last victory I was picking through the slain, found a man's arm cut clean off. It was that Syrio! That could have been my arm!{***}

str_npc4_personalityclash2_speech_b|He's done it with such an innocent look as if he remarked upon the weather during some of the usual talks around the camp. I'm not sure what sort of man he is. Safer to travel without him.{***}

str_npc5_personalityclash2_speech_b|I cannot fight alongside a man who's like to stab me in the back instead of covering it. He says he was a soldier but I don't know what use he would have been except for looting the dead - that he has been mastering over the years.{***}
str_npc6_personalityclash2_speech_b|....{***}
str_npc7_personalityclash2_speech_b|After the last battle he let out a roar so furious and full of blood thirst that I decided it's safer to keep a healthy distance from him at all times.{***}
str_npc8_personalityclash2_speech_b|All my life men like him have sneered at me. And all my life I've been knocking men like him into the dust.{***}

str_npc9_personalityclash2_speech_b|During last battle I constantly felt his eyes upon me and expected an arrow 'nto my back all the time. I had t' worry more about that than an enemy swinging his sword in front of my face.{***}
str_npc10_personalityclash2_speech_b|But the boy just left Xhondo there to bring 'help'. All help Xhondo needed was the boy's sword. Xhondo says, splay coward's blood across the deck.{***}

str_npc11_personalityclash2_speech_b|I've seen him hesitating before finishing one of our foes off in the last battle. This boy is too green to kill people, he should be left at the first town we pass by and work there as some apprentice.{***}

str_npc12_personalityclash2_speech_b|He's got courage, and strength, but there is no kindness in him, and little loyalty. He doesn't want me coming along and makes that apparent. He says that I should stop playing at war and become a bard rather, that low-born!{***}
str_npc13_personalityclash2_speech_b|I can cut off his manhood and feed it to the goats as an example of what happens to cowards for your troops. If he has any, and I doubt that.{***}
str_npc14_personalityclash2_speech_b|And he tends to like fighting a few enemies at once. I can't always cover his big black back, he'll just end up dying on us. Better get rid of him now.{***}
str_npc15_personalityclash2_speech_b|none.{***}
str_kurleket_personalityclash2_speech_b|...{***}
str_thoros_personalityclash2_speech_b|....{***}
str_dacey_personalityclash2_speech_b|Or a woman who thinks she's a knight.{***}
str_wunwun_personalityclash2_speech_b|n/a{***}
str_dongo_personalityclash2_speech_b|none.{***}
str_1_personalityclash2_speech_b|I warn you, his nature will never change.{***}
str_2_personalityclash2_speech_b|Just another obstacle I had to overcome on the path of the Eyrie.{***}
str_3_personalityclash2_speech_b|Today she learned I am big enough where it counts when I slew those men.{***}
str_4_personalityclash2_speech_b|I have seen more life and motivation in a wight than that useless excuse of a man.{***}
str_5_personalityclash2_speech_b|He calls himself a navigator. Pah! He cannot navigate himself out of a wet paper bag.{***}
str_6_personalityclash2_speech_b|My abilities far out reach his in healing, spare your men the agony of becoming his next experiment.{***}
str_son_personalityclash2_speech_b|... {***}
str_daughter_personalityclash2_speech_b|...{***}
str_event_personalityclash2_speech_b|...{***}
str_npc1_personalitymatch_speech|I was impressed with {s11}'s skills in that last battle.{***}

str_npc2_personalitymatch_speech|The last inn we stopped at, the beer was good and the women, well lets just say I've never seen finer tits in the whole of Westeros. I could have landed myself a suckle until {s11} jumped in front of me... though I do like his style. {***}
str_npc3_personalitymatch_speech|Do you think {s11} would like a man like me?... Obviously not me, but someone like.. me?{***}

str_npc4_personalitymatch_speech|Commander, {s11} is a worthy and just man, not to mention his expertise with bow and arrows. I feel much more confident knowing that he watches my back in battle. He has saved me a couple of times already.{***}

str_npc5_personalitymatch_speech|Commander, I just wanted to point out that you did the right thing by taking {s11} along. He knows how to fight and how to tell stories, too. His are ones of the most interesting that I've heard in a long time.{***}
str_npc6_personalitymatch_speech|The Braavosi that travels with us. I've never seen swordplay of such beauty.{***}

str_npc7_personalitymatch_speech|Sire, the Summer Islander that travels with us is an interesting person indeed. {s11} has told me some things about the rituals and medicine of his people, that I found most exciting to hear about.{***}
str_npc8_personalitymatch_speech|He's learning quick that one. Not bad with a sword either!{***}

str_npc9_personalitymatch_speech|Commander, that {s11} is a good and honest man and knows the taste o' gold better than I do. Over some goat leg and ale he started tellin' me about all the different coins, how before Stags and Dragons every Kingdom had its own coinage. You e'er heard about that? I didn't.{***}
