str_npc10_personalitymatch_speech|Captain, Xhondo think {s11} is a good man and a good healer. Each time Xhondo was wounded, he cured Xhondo.{***}

str_npc11_personalitymatch_speech|Leader, {s11} is quite a good company. We were sitting by the camp fire and sharing some stories of our past and enjoying the beautiful evening. You should take a closer look at him or even promote him.{***}

str_npc12_personalitymatch_speech|Commander, I wanted to say that {s11} was certainly a great choice of yours. There are not many warriors around so experienced as our brave Ser Illifer not to mention his bloodline.{***}

str_npc13_personalitymatch_speech|Chief, that {s11} is a worthy fighter. He shows no mercy nor asks for it, just like me. He knows fighting isn't about showing off swordplay, it's about butchering the poor fool in front of you for crow food and moving on to his mates!{***}
str_npc14_personalitymatch_speech|Captain, the smith {s11} you took with us is a good and honest lad. He's not yet experienced with a blade but he makes fine weapons and armour.{***}
str_npc15_personalitymatch_speech|My lord, {s11}'s swordplay is very impressive.{***}
str_kurleket_personalitymatch_speech|...{***}
str_thoros_personalitymatch_speech|{s11}'s an honest lad, who detests those who prey on the weak.{***}
str_dacey_personalitymatch_speech|My uncle Jorah always said that {s11} was the bravest man he had ever seen.{***}
str_wunwun_personalitymatch_speech|Wun-Wun like Dongo.{***}
str_dongo_personalitymatch_speech|Dongo like Wun-Wun.{***}
str_1_personalitymatch_speech|Mya is a fair and beautiful lady, I would give her my love but she only thinks of Mychel Redfort.{***}
str_2_personalitymatch_speech|When I look at him, there is something very familiar about him.{***}
str_3_personalitymatch_speech|Mormont knows a true warrior shows their skills only on the field of battle.{***}
str_4_personalitymatch_speech|Though she is not pretty, I bet she would give Tormund a hard on.{***}
str_5_personalitymatch_speech|I know Lady Val is a woman, but the things I would do with her would make even you grin.{***}
str_6_personalitymatch_speech|Ser Beron behaves as the knights whose legends echo in eternity.{***}
str_son_personalitymatch_speech|...{***}
str_daughter_personalitymatch_speech|...{***}
str_event_personalitymatch_speech|...{***}
str_npc1_personalitymatch_speech_b|Without good honest folk like him here, we would all surely be doomed. I'll warrant. I'm glad to have him with us.{***}
str_npc2_personalitymatch_speech_b|Though, there's always next time aye m'lord?! heheheh.{***}
str_npc3_personalitymatch_speech_b|I also confess that I... Am I talking too much again?{***}

str_npc4_personalitymatch_speech_b|He's relentless with bandits and I cannot say I dislike that. Quite the contrary, I took to them in time. Maybe one day we will devote our lives to cause of protecting the realm from brigands.{***}

str_npc5_personalitymatch_speech_b|His blood and manners are both noble and make for a great company on the field of battle same as by the camp fire. With his sword at my side I'm not hesitating to rush into where the fight is the thickest.{***}
str_npc6_personalitymatch_speech_b|I've travelled to Braavos many a time. I've seen the swords of Braavos just a few, but this ones different.{***}

str_npc7_personalitymatch_speech_b|He doesn't speak the Common Tongue well yet he grasps the idea quickly and replies according to the point, without blabbering or changing topic. We got along quite well.{***}
str_npc8_personalitymatch_speech_b|You should be glad we have people of his nature in our company.{***}

str_npc9_personalitymatch_speech_b|He knows everything 'bout trade and we would do well to use his knowledge from time t' time. I'll help keep him out o' the fighting, we cannot afford losing such a useful member of our host.{***}
str_npc10_personalitymatch_speech_b|He knows things of Summer Islands and teaches Xhondo your Westerosi Tongue. One day Xhondo will best your kings at talking.{***}

str_npc11_personalitymatch_speech_b|He is a formidable and experienced soldier, after all and knows which things shine the brightest. A rather reticent and unremarkable but yet invaluable member of our warband.{***}
str_npc12_personalitymatch_speech_b|I consider it a great honour to fight alongside him and I gladly share bread and mead with him after battles. Perhaps we shall seek fortune together one day.{***}

str_npc13_personalitymatch_speech_b|And he knows how to drink and feast! Last night we have eaten up a whole ox and drunken 2 casks of mead! Any man that dares attack Bronn I'll tear asunder with my own bare hands!{***}
str_npc14_personalitymatch_speech_b|He also has a proper sense of what's right and just in this world, I like that. Men like this lad won't betray you or stab you in the back.{***}
str_npc15_personalitymatch_speech_b|She knows her limits, and executes every attack perfectly! I'm glad to have someone like her by my side. You made good sense by bringing her to our company.{***}
str_kurleket_personalitymatch_speech_b|...{***}
str_thoros_personalitymatch_speech_b|There is also no better archer.{***}
str_dacey_personalitymatch_speech_b|You did well to bring him to our cause, even if he is half drunk by breakfast.{***}
str_wunwun_personalitymatch_speech_b|Dongo fights like giant. Giants fight well.{***}
str_dongo_personalitymatch_speech_b|Together we smash our foes!{***}
str_1_personalitymatch_speech_b|That boy is either confused or a fool.{***}
str_2_personalitymatch_speech_b|It is almost as I am looking in a Mirror.{***}
str_3_personalitymatch_speech_b|She is honourable and full of charisma.{***}
str_4_personalitymatch_speech_b|I know the way he looks at her.{***}
str_5_personalitymatch_speech_b|I hope you are not blushing {playername}.{***}
str_6_personalitymatch_speech_b|You did well to hire such a noble man.{***}
str_son_personalitymatch_speech_b|....{***}
str_daughter_personalitymatch_speech_b|...{***}
str_event_personalitymatch_speech_b|...{***}

str_npc1_retirement_speech|I'm a bit tired of marching up and down the land, shedding my blood for someone else's cause. I'm going to head back to Braavos, see some old friends. I think a deserve a vacation, after all.{***}
str_npc2_retirement_speech|Your gold is lacking and I've had better offers elsewhere. Its time for me to move on.{***}
str_npc3_retirement_speech|I am afraid I have something to tell you. I know you will be very upset for loosing such an honourable and gallant knight.. but I'm leaving.{***}

str_npc4_retirement_speech|Commander, I think I will be staying in the next town we get to. I don't feel like I'm doing what I was meant to do fighting for you. Thank you for bringing me along but I yearn for the heat of the smithy more than the fires of battle.{***}

str_npc5_retirement_speech|Commander, perhaps it is time I seek some rest for my old bones. I can no longer remain as stalwart in battles as I used to be and, sadly, that means I'm a done fighter. Possibly we will meet again.{***}
str_npc6_retirement_speech|It seems my call has been answered else where. I'm here to tell you that I must regretfully leave your companionship now.{***}

str_npc7_retirement_speech|Sire, it is time I tried to establish myself at some court and remain safely behind stone walls of some castle. Travelling with you was a marvellous experience, but our ways part here and now.{***}
str_npc8_retirement_speech|We've had many battles and you've been kind to me, which I thank you for. But I feel my worthiness has been proven and I must now move on. I wish you well.{***}

str_npc9_retirement_speech|Commander, it's time for old Dick to spend well-earned coins and feast on our victories. It was great sightseeing around The Seven Kingdoms with you but people get tired after some time and so do I. Seek me out later, we'll drink t' our battles.{***}
str_npc10_retirement_speech|Captain, Xhondo wants to visit Summer Islands again before something happens to him. You must understand and not hold Xhondo.{***}

str_npc11_retirement_speech|Leader, I thank you for bringing me along but I'm afraid I can no longer stay in your service. I'll make my way home and try to start up some investments. Perhaps we'll see each other again.{***}

str_npc12_retirement_speech|Commander, I've had my share of glorious battles with you for now. It is time for Ser Creighton Longbough to regale his friends with stories and hear songs of my deeds. Maybe some king will make me lord of a castle? Who knows?{***}

str_npc13_retirement_speech|Chief, I hear a call inside me that I can't resist. I must respond to it and find peace. You have proved your worth to me on the field of battle and I shall seek you when I feel bloodthirsty again.{***}

str_npc14_retirement_speech|Captain, fighting alongside you was an honour, but I must take another road now. I'll drink to your health in my travels and if R'hllor allows, we'll see each other again.{***}

str_npc15_retirement_speech|My lord, There's something I want to tell you. I don't feel like I'm doing what I was meant to do fighting for you. Thank you for enlisting me but I just think my place is somewhere else.{***}
str_kurleket_retirement_speech|I feel I must go out and explore the world on my own for a while.{***}
str_thoros_retirement_speech|The Lord of Light calls me. We must part ways I'm afraid.{***}
str_dacey_retirement_speech|I think I have gained enough experience with your company now. The banners are calling and I must go where I belong.{***}
str_wunwun_retirement_speech|Wun-Wun not happy. Wun-Wun leave now.{***}
str_dongo_retirement_speech|Dongo must leave.{***}
str_1_retirement_speech|There are things I must do alone. I still have a score to settle with the Lannisters, perhaps we shall meet again.{***}
str_2_retirement_speech|A Stone must return to her Mountain. Keep the others safe, I hope to see you again.{***}
str_3_retirement_speech|I must seek another lord to serve. Perhaps another day we will seek blood and battle together.{***}
str_4_retirement_speech|Things are not going as well as I imagined, I must return home to help my people, perhaps we shall meet again under better circumstances.{***}
str_5_retirement_speech|It is time for me to return to the Iron Islands and take command of a ship and crew.{***}
str_6_retirement_speech|I must leave your side, I can no longer bring myself to harm another person.{***}
str_son_retirement_speech|{Father/Mother}, I feel I must go out and explore the world on my own for a while.{***}
str_daughter_retirement_speech|{Father/Mother}, I feel I must go out and explore the world on my own for a while.{***}
str_event_retirement_speech|I feel I must go out and explore the world on my own for a while.{***}
str_npc1_rehire_speech|It's good to see you again. I would very much like to re-join your cause.{***}
str_npc2_rehire_speech|Well well, look who it is. Have your pockets grown to allow enough gold to let me back where I belong?{***}
str_npc3_rehire_speech|Well, hello {ser/madame}! It is very good to see you again. I have not fared so well since we parted, maybe you would like your old pal back?{***}
str_npc4_rehire_speech|It's good to see you, Commander. Life of a smith isn't as glorious as one of a fighter. Perhaps you could use my services once again?{***}

str_npc5_rehire_speech|Greetings, Commander. It seems these old bones can still enjoy the heat of battle as I found out after some rest. Do you seek someone to make seasoned men out of your recruits?{***}
str_npc6_rehire_speech|Your grace. It seems my duties are to be here. Will you allow me to serve with you once again?{***}
str_npc7_rehire_speech|Sire! How glad I am to see you. I have understood that life at court is too tedious for me. Mayhaps you want me to tend to your sick and wounded once again?{***}
str_npc8_rehire_speech|Greetings to you, {playername}.{***}
str_npc9_rehire_speech|It has been quite a while, Commander! But my pockets are close t' empty now. How about re-establishing our good old relations?{***}
str_npc10_rehire_speech|Xhondo is pleased to see this face again. No one left to rule your ship, so you seek Xhondo?{***}

str_npc11_rehire_speech|Well if it isn't my old glorious Leader! I managed to make a few investments but they will take some time to bear fruit. In the meantime I'm looking for work. Are you in need of my services?{***}

str_npc12_rehire_speech|Well met, Commander! The wars rage on but I've had little luck finding a lord that can afford my services. I know you to be well supplied with coin and so I offer you my sword once more.{***}

str_npc13_rehire_speech|My old Chief! I have found the peace I sought back in the Mountains of the Moon. But now I feel the lust for battle raising anew in me. Let me chop off the manhood of each of all your foes!{***}
str_npc14_rehire_speech|It's good to see your face again, captain! Have you run out of good archers and found me to fight together once again?{***}
str_npc15_rehire_speech|It's good to see you, my lord. I've reconsidered my options and I would like to join your retinue again.{***}
str_kurleket_rehire_speech|It is good to see you again. I shall ride with you once again.{***}
str_thoros_rehire_speech|The Lord has sent me back to you {playername}. Perhaps we should join forces once again?{***}
str_dacey_rehire_speech|Will you allow me to serve with you once again?{***}
str_wunwun_rehire_speech|Wun-Wun rejoin?{***}
str_dongo_rehire_speech|Dongo glad see master.{***}
str_1_rehire_speech|I will gladly return to your side, I have missed you my friend.{***}
str_2_rehire_speech|I have longed for this day. It is good to be back at your side.{***}
str_3_rehire_speech|A toast to success in future wars.{***}
str_4_rehire_speech|I have missed you. Hopefully things will work out better this time.{***}
str_5_rehire_speech|Lets down a few ales to celebrate our reuniting and hit the local brothel.{***}
str_6_rehire_speech|It is good to see you again. Perhaps you need me to take a look at your wounded men?{***}
str_son_rehire_speech|It is good to see you again {father/mother}. I shall ride with you once again.{***}
str_daughter_rehire_speech|It is good to see you again {father/mother}. I shall ride with you once again.{***}
str_event_rehire_speech|It is good to see you again. I shall ride with you once again.{***}

str_npc1_home_intro|We are very close to Braavos where I once lived and worked as the first sword of Braavos. The city's linked across a hundred islands, its a sight to behold. You should definitely pay a visit there soon if possible.{***}
str_npc2_home_intro|We're approaching Kings Landing. The capital of Westeros.{***}
str_npc3_home_intro|Can you smell that? No? Oh, umm me neither.{***}
str_npc4_home_intro|King's Landing. Never thought I'd see it again. Not after my trouble with the city watch anyways. Good place to live if you have the coin, but a living hell if you don't.{***}

str_npc5_home_intro|Stoney Sept... This place brings back enduring memories. Did I tell you that I had fought in the Battle of the Bells, one of the most important battles of Robert's Rebellion? It was fought here, in this town.{***}
str_npc6_home_intro|We are nearing Harvest Hall, the seat of House Selmy.{***}

str_npc7_home_intro|Do you know the story of this enormous castle, Harrenhal? Harren the Black, King of the Iron Islands and the Riverlands, built Harrenhal as a monument to himself, intending it to be the greatest of all castles in Westeros and for it to dwarf any other.{***}
str_npc8_home_intro|You wonder why they call me Brienne of Tarth?{***}

str_npc9_home_intro|Maidenpool, good place for a rest after a long walk on the road. It's the seat of House Mooton, with that chubby William Mooton and that red fish on his soldiers teats. The Stinking Goose is where you want to go to buy a room and get some food and other pleasures.{***}

str_npc10_home_intro|Oldtown is where Quhuru Mo left Xhondo. Xhondo knows some history. Oldtown survived the Andal invasion. City welcomed the Andals, not resisted them. Also, during the Great Spring Sickness Oldtown suffered badly. Only King's Landing suffered worse.{***}

str_npc11_home_intro|It has been some time since I came to Lannisport. I was actually here when the Ironborn burned the Lannister fleet during the Greyjoy Rebellion. I had come with my father to attend a wedding and ended up at a funeral.{***}

str_npc12_home_intro|Ah, Duskendale, I have friends here and many a good memories. Still, the place has a sad history to it as well. Have you ever heard of the Defiance of Duskendale? I am no bard, but I can tell you of it because I was there when it happened.{***}

str_npc13_home_intro|Mountains of the Moon have always been my true home. The Stone Crows, one of the tribes around here, are led by me. We did not recognize the authority of the Eyrie so these cravens outlawed us.{***}

str_npc14_home_intro|I grew up here, in Blackhaven. Did you know that when Ser Barristan Selmy was ten years old, he borrowed armour and entered a tourney as a mystery knight that took place here?{***}
str_npc15_home_intro|Golden Tooth. Never thought I'd see it again. I used to serve my lord here.{***}
str_kurleket_home_intro|We are nearing Braavos {my lord/mylady}. A great many ships pass through here everyday. There is also the Bank of Braavos where we can borrow money for our next campaign.{***}
str_thoros_home_intro|We are nearing Myr. They call this here the fertile heel of Essos, an ancient Valyrian dragonroad.{***}
str_dacey_home_intro|We are nearing Bear Island, my home. They say that King Rodrick Stark won it in a wrestling match before granting it to House Mormont.{***}
str_wunwun_home_intro|Thenn, home of the most advanced of the little people this side of wall.{***}
str_dongo_home_intro|Fist of First Man home of Tormund.{***}

str_1_home_intro|My family owed allegiance to the House of Darry. Lord Raymun Darry knighted me, he was a good man and his son Lyman was an honourable lad that rode atop my shoulders many times during feast.{***}
str_2_home_intro|Watch your step, do not forget I know this mountain better than anyone.{***}

str_3_home_intro|The first battle of Robert’s Rebellion took place here. Marq Grafton refused to answer Jon Arryn’s banner call, and called all those loyal to Aerys II Targaryn to join him in holding Gulltown.{***}
str_4_home_intro|She is a real bitch to climb ya know, 700 feet high all the way to the top.{***}
str_5_home_intro|Pyke has always been a tough nut to crack defensively. King Balon and his Brother Euron thought it impregnable.{***}
str_6_home_intro|I am at her side, it is Mother Rhoyne, how beautiful she is.{***}
str_son_home_intro|...{***}
str_daughter_home_intro|...{***}
str_event_home_intro|...{***}
str_npc1_home_description|well, it was once called the secret city and was unknown to the world for centuries. It was only really recognised after the doom of Valyria.{***}
str_npc2_home_description|Perhaps I should get myself some whores for the night, eh?!{***}
str_npc3_home_description|What in the Seven Hells is THAT?!{***}
str_npc4_home_description|City's divided by coin, you see
column2: poorer folk lives in the slums of Flea Bottom and those that are rich live on the other side of Rhaenys's Hill or even by the Old Gate. Then you have merchant and work districts like the Street of Steel for smiths.{***}

column1: str_npc5_home_description|Forces of King Aerys were chasing after Robert Baratheon, attempting to cut him off from his northern allies. Robert was wounded and hiding here. Jon Connington took the town by force and began searching for him from house to house. Then Eddard Stark's and Hoster Tully's forces swept into the town. Connington fought back fiercely. Then Robert came out and led a counter attack.{***}
str_npc6_home_description|I grew up at Harvest Hall. The land round here is extremely arable and Harvest Hall produces more crops than most other regions in the Stormlands.{***}

str_npc7_home_description|The construction of his dream took about forty years. Upon its completion, King Harren boasted that his new fortress was impregnable, and it was. However, he failed to take into account Aegon the Conqueror and his dragons invading Westeros shortly after the building was finished.{***}
str_npc8_home_description|The island of Tarth, and there's Evanfall Hall.{***}

str_npc9_home_description|Town's got a harbour too, with ships coming and going even during the war. Bay of Crabs is nearby. This place is sorta my home away from home, being close to Crackclaw Point, you see. I like it here, though I cannot really explain the nature of my affection.{***}

str_npc10_home_description|A beautiful city. Also one of the most important ports. Trading ships from Westeros, Summer Islands, Free Cities and other places come here. Always a crowd in the harbours.{***}

str_npc11_home_description|But I would rather speak of the great works that take place here. All roads lead to Lannisport, and those roads are paved with gold! The Westerlands have a great abundance of gold mines, and Casterly Rock sits upon the largest lode. The city is not as large as King's landing but it has far less slums and far more business. The city watch is not as corrupt as the Gold Cloaks of King's Landing, and they are a good deal more reliable too.{***}

str_npc12_home_description|I was a squire back then, fetching swords and tending the horses. King Aerys had gone to Duskendale to settle the matter of town not paying taxes, but the Darklyns who ruled there took him prisoner. A great host was brought to the gates by the Hand, Tywin Lannister. But all those men were for naught, the Darklyns would open the King's throat the moment they attacked.{***}

str_npc13_home_description|We raid and plunder their villages, steal cattle and women, capture lordling's worth good ransom. We won't accept no rule over us. We're free people and we will live and die free. And no one dares attack us in OUR mountains, because they know we will kill them all to the last!{***}
str_npc14_home_description|He was eventually defeated and unmasked by Prince Duncan Targaryen. For that, Ser Barristan earned the nickname 'Bold'. Hard to believe, but that is true.{***}
str_npc15_home_description|Ser Lorimer. A skilled man, but not a wise one. He used to train me every morning. I thought I'd be a knight one day with his tutelage.{***}
str_kurleket_home_description|I would advise you to pay the money back though {my lord/my lady}. How do you think I had become...{***}
str_thoros_home_description|This, is where I grew up. Famed for its arts and learning. Or if your like me, learning the arts of R'hllor.{***}
str_dacey_home_description|There’s a carving on our gate. A woman in a bearskin, with a child in one arm suckling at her breast. In the other hand, she holds a battleaxe.{***}
str_wunwun_home_description|Nice free folk armour and weapons forged here. I like big mace to make crows go splat.{***}

str_dongo_home_description|Tormund name Giant’s Bane a lie. Tormund lost, cold, and almost dead. Tormund found cave. Woman giant lived there, he cut open her belly and crawled inside. When giant woke up, she thought she had given birth.{***}

str_1_home_description|The Lannisters started this war by letting Ser Gregor Clegane ravage our lands. Then Ser Gregor killed our Lord Raymun Darry, who with Beric Dondarrion, tried to stop this rampage on orders of the King’s Hand, Ned Stark. Then Clegane killed his son Lyman Darry, an 8-year-old child, who refused to bend the knee to the Lannisters, destroying that noble house completely.{***}

str_2_home_description|This path was my prison, a convenient place where a single misstep or brigand could kill me. My father tried to bring me to King’s Landing after he was crowned, but Queen Cersei told him 'the city is not a healthy place for a growing girl.{***}
str_3_home_description|While Eddard Stark sailed to the North from the Fingers to call his banners, the Vale Knights loyal to Jon Arryn laid siege to the town and stormed the defences.{***}
str_4_home_description|The wall may protect Southerners, but it has trapped us Freefolk ever since Brandon the Builder laid down the first blocks of ice.{***}
str_5_home_description|That was until the Greyjoy Rebellion when Robert Baratheon and Eddard Stark unleashed their siege engines on the Southern Wall.{***}
str_6_home_description|North of Selhorys is where my people called home before the dragon lords brought fire and blood upon our people and drove us across the sea to Westeros.{***}
str_son_home_description|...{***}
str_daughter_home_description|...{***}
str_event_home_description|...{***}
str_npc1_home_description_2|Their are no trees in Braavos, but home to many stone and granite monuments.{***}
str_npc2_home_description_2|There's enough here to go around, I can assure you that.{***}
str_npc3_home_description_2|Jeez that's not good.{***}
str_npc4_home_description_2|Some unknown lord paid for my apprentice fees. I always wondered why.{***}

str_npc5_home_description_2|When Connington saw the battle was lost, he retreated in good order and was afterwards exiled for his failure by Aerys. The battle is called so because at the beginning of the it the sept tolled the city bells to warn the citizens of the battle and to persuade them to stay inside their houses.{***}
str_npc6_home_description_2|I was next in line to inherit the seat of House Selmy but gave up my claim after becoming a Kingsguard.{***}

str_npc7_home_description_2|The dragons were not obstructed by high walls and forbidding towers, for dragons fly. They roasted Harren alive in the tallest of the towers, now known as the Kingspyre. Due to the extreme heat, the castle took on a charred, melted appearance.{***}
str_npc8_home_description_2|They call this place the Sapphire isle, though unfortunately not for the abundance of sapphires.{***}

str_npc9_home_description_2|Maidenpool has never seen no maidens in no bloody pools, though. It takes its name from the pool where the legendary Florian first spied Jonquil bathing with her sisters. Must've been a good sight, right?{***}

str_npc10_home_description_2|But truly the symbol of Oldtown is Hightower. Xhondo thinks it's tallest structure in your land. Its beacon can be seen from many miles in the sea. A welcoming sight, once.{***}

str_npc11_home_description_2|I've always dreamed of setting up shop here and dealing with the renowned goldsmiths that live here. But what I would have to pay for the necessary permits and licenses would bankrupt most noble houses!{***}

str_npc12_home_description_2|This went on until Barristan the Bold walked into the camp with the King in tow. He had single-handedly sneaked into the Dun Fort and saved Aerys. Without their hostage the Darklyns surrendered in hopes of finding mercy but they were beheaded all to the last, Duskendale given to House Rykker.{***}

str_npc13_home_description_2|Lords and ladies, knights and sellswords - they are all the same in some sense. They all soil their pants when they are brought before me, hah! You are what you are in the Mountains of the Moon and there is no more pretending there.{***}

str_npc14_home_description_2|My father was local Lord's huntsman. He taught me how to use the bow and how to fletch arrows. Sometimes, he took me with him on long hunts during which we almost reached Ashford on foot.{***}
str_npc15_home_description_2|I'm sure my father would be proud of me now.{***}
str_kurleket_home_description_2|Well, lets not dwindle on the past.{***}
str_thoros_home_description_2|I was one of eight children handed over to the priests. Never have been that devout mind you and it certainly was not by choice.{***}
str_dacey_home_description_2|She’s no proper lady, that one, but I always loved her.{***}
str_wunwun_home_description_2|Wun-Wun eat now.{***}
str_dongo_home_description_2|She forced Tormund to suckle her for 3 moons until he escaped, earned name Giant’s Babe.{***}
str_1_home_description_2|To add insult to injury the Lannisters unleashed the Brave Companions upon us.{***}
str_2_home_description_2|I never saw my father again after Cersei’s threat, but I know I had his love.{***}
str_3_home_description_2|The defenders soon surrendered when Robert Baratheon killed Marq Grafton.{***}
str_4_home_description_2|You can say the White Walkers are fairy tales, but you don’t build a 300-mile-long wall that is 700 feet high to stop a fairy tale.{***}

str_5_home_description_2|After the wall came crashing down the fire wielding legend Thoros of Myr came charging through the breach with Jorah Mormont and Jaime Lannister in one of the greatest feats of valour in history.{***}
str_6_home_description_2|I thank you for allowing me to see my true home.{***}
str_son_home_description_2|...{***}
str_daughter_home_description_2|...{***}
str_event_home_description_2|...{***}
str_npc1_home_recap|I'm from Essos, where I learned to handle a sword and the meaning of honour.{***}
str_npc2_home_recap|Blackwater.. damned place.{***}
str_npc3_home_recap|I used to live in {s20} ya know... or was I just visiting.. I forget now.{***}
str_npc4_home_recap|I was born a bastard and my mother died when I was very young, fortunately I managed to get an apprenticeship with Tobho Mott. I guess I was lucky.{***}

str_npc5_home_recap|The sept sits on a hill. Below it is a holdfast made of grey stone that seems undersized for the town that surrounds it. The heart of Stoney Sept is a market square with a fountain in the shape of a leaping trout.{***}

str_npc6_home_recap|I was named to the Kingsguard when I was just 23 years old and had the white cloak placed opon my shoulders by Ser Gerold Hightower. All those years back yet I still remember it well.{***}

str_npc7_home_recap|Harrenhal is a great castle constructed before the War of Conquest, located in the Riverlands, on the north shore of the Gods Eye lake. It is the largest castle in the Seven Kingdoms. Since the War of Conquest, however, it has become a dark and ruinous place.{***}
str_npc8_home_recap|The evenstar sent me away to Storms End. It feels good to be back, even if only for a brief while.{***}

str_npc9_home_recap|The castle at Maidenpool sits on a hill, and the town is walled. East of Maidenpool are hills. There are two roads leading to King's Landing from Maidenpool. One that goes through Duskendale and the other which travels along the coast. The former is the fastest one.{***}

str_npc10_home_recap|Many rivers and canals criss cross its cobbled streets. Stone mansions are common here. The city is a labyrinth of wynds, alleys and streets. The temples that cater to foreign sailors are all located down by the wharves.{***}

str_npc11_home_recap|Nestled by the Sunset Sea with gold in its hills, Lannisport truly is a gem among cities. I look forward to the day I can make my home there and leave behind my life on the roads.{***}

str_npc12_home_recap|Duskendale spreads out around the harbour and has cobbled streets. The castle that overlooks the port is known as the Dun Fort. It is a squat square stone castle with big drum towers of House Rykker.{***}

str_npc13_home_recap|Their foothills are rocky, high and wild. The mountains have snow-capped peaks. Rock slides are common here. The eastern road from the Crossroads Inn passes through the Mountains of the Moon.{***}

str_npc14_home_recap|Blackhaven has a long history as a defensive fortification against attacks out of Dorne to the south. This is due to Dornish Marches being a common battleground between the Stormlands, the Reach and Dorne for over a thousand years.{***}
str_npc15_home_recap|Well, let's forget about all that. Time to move forward.{***}
str_kurleket_home_recap|Remember, if you do not pay back the Bank of Braavos, you will pay the Iron price.{***}
str_thoros_home_recap|Ahh, It's good to remember the fine wine and the fine girls of Myr. It's always a pleasure to be home.{***}
str_dacey_home_recap|Bear Island is an island in the far North. We can get there by ferry, though having our own ship would be much more preferable.{***}
str_wunwun_home_recap|'Grunts'{***}
str_dongo_home_recap|'Groans'{***}
str_1_home_recap|Every time I see Darry I am overcome with a great sense of loss and then anger towards the Lannisters.{***}
str_2_home_recap|It is hard not to have dreams of grandeur when you gaze at the Eyrie. I often imagined myself as a mighty lady ruling from it’s ramparts.{***}
str_3_home_recap|I could not get away from Gulltown fast enough when I was a lowly Paige.{***}
str_4_home_recap|Frostfang’s camp, it isn’t much to look at. It is filled with dreamers wanting to go south or those filled with terrors of the White Walkers.{***}
str_5_home_recap|Beyond the decks of the Black Wind, Pyke has become a home to me.”{***}
str_6_home_recap|I remember the wagon loads of wounded men that rolled through Planky Town after Robert’s Rebellion. That is when I decided to become a healer to help ease the pain of others.{***}
str_son_home_recap|...{***}
str_daughter_home_recap|...{***}
str_event_home_recap|...{***}

str_npc1_kingsupport_1|That's a great idea, {ser/madame}. All the kingdoms are currently at war bringing hardship to everyone within the realm. Someone needs to bring honour back to these lands and theirs no reason it cannot be you.{***}
str_npc2_kingsupport_1|Well, I'd support you. I think you'd give the people the kind of ruler which they have long needed.{***}
str_npc3_kingsupport_1|Well, Young One - I would worry for you.{***}
str_npc4_kingsupport_1|Well, {playername}, you're a great leader and your valour in battle and mastery of command do deserve a throne.{***}

str_npc5_kingsupport_1|This feat has great a risk but yields a great reward if accomplished. If I accompany you, this is going to be my last significant deed, I wager. You have my support in this.{***}
str_npc6_kingsupport_1|I would gladly follow your grace. Though please take note of all the people I have served, the worst were those who played the game of thrones.{***}

str_npc7_kingsupport_1|Say no more. I can see it in your eyes that you are as certain of your success as a man can be. Perhaps this is a chance for me to do something in my life worth being remembered after my death.{***}
str_npc8_kingsupport_1|I would follow you wherever your Grace.{***}

str_npc9_kingsupport_1|Bloody business. That's what I think about it. Profitable, however, in the end. And with you being at the helm of your company this venture does have a chance of workin' out.{***}
str_npc10_kingsupport_1|This is troubling. Xhondo is not from this land, but Xhondo likes it here. Xhondo will help.{***}

str_npc11_kingsupport_1|A bid for the throne? That’s a gamble that would give even my late father pause. Anyone else I would've considered a madman or feverish, but in you I do see a potential investment.{***}

str_npc12_kingsupport_1|You will not stop until you become a King or lay dead in some godforsaken crypt, will you? That's the same I would do in your stead! Just imagine how famous we will become. Not that I lack fame, but there can't be too much of it, right?{***}

str_npc13_kingsupport_1|Well, Chief, you're the boldest little fighter I've met. Normally I just take what my strength allows me to take, but we have been through too many battles together for me to abandon you on this way.{***}

str_npc14_kingsupport_1|A throne, huh? Well, if we were just a brotherhood of knights seeking brigands and criminals, I would've called you a madman. But we have made ourselves quite a reputation. I'm with you, Captain.{***}
str_npc15_kingsupport_1|Well, my lord, you're a great leader and your valour in battle and mastery of command do deserve a throne.{***}
str_kurleket_kingsupport_1|You saved me {my lord/my lady}. I will follow you as you please. I am sure you will make a fine {king/queen}.{***}

str_thoros_kingsupport_1|The only King I ever formed a friendship with was Robert Baratheon, since we liked to drink, fight, and fornicate. I don’t think those things make a good king. But with you I have seen courage, a sense of justice, and the ability to fight the monster that the ravages of war often create.{***}

str_dacey_kingsupport_1|My family has declared fidelity to King Winter, Robb Stark. I believe in honouring the oaths and pledges of my family, I cannot be blind to my belief you can bring peace back to the land.{***}
str_wunwun_kingsupport_1|Giants have no king, live like bears. {playername} want to rule over little people?{***}
str_dongo_kingsupport_1|Free Folk will follow {playername}, we like {playername}.{***}
str_1_kingsupport_1|You have helped the people my family are sworn to protect. I gladly serve you for that deed alone.{***}
str_2_kingsupport_1|We both have dreams. I will support yours as you have supported mine.{***}

str_3_kingsupport_1|I pledged you my blade, if that is what you desire then I will cut a bloody swath through your enemies until they bend the knee or cease breathing. They will tremble at the mention of your name after I carve it into your enemies..{***}
str_4_kingsupport_1|You pledged to help my people and I pledged to help you.{***}
str_5_kingsupport_1|I will gladly tell all the Ironmen that they should support you in your cause.{***}
str_6_kingsupport_1|Nothing would please me more than to see you on the Iron Throne.{***}
str_son_kingsupport_1|....{***}
str_daughter_kingsupport_1|....{***}
str_event_kingsupport_1|....{***}
str_npc1_kingsupport_2|Of course. I can train your soldiers into great swordsmen. With swords as good as these by your side, who's to ever oppose you?{***}
str_npc2_kingsupport_2|As long as you shit gold and pass some my way, I'm all for it 'Your Grace'.{***}
str_npc3_kingsupport_2|I would, my {lord/lady}. But I would ask you to establish at least a minimal amount of erm.. agh crap.. what was I saying?{***}

str_npc4_kingsupport_2|I would, but you should give me your word that you will do your best to guard the innocents from monsters like Ser Gregor Clegane. Also, something needs to be done with prices on raw smithing materials.{***}

str_npc5_kingsupport_2|Definitely. But don't misunderstand me, Commander, I'm an old man and I want to have a warm and stout castle to spend my last days in, maybe even acquire a family and an heir to which I could hand down all my legacy.{***}

str_npc6_kingsupport_2|I would tell anyone who listens of your deeds on behalf of the weak and helpless, of your ability to lead men against great odds and triumph, and tell them that if you were to become {king/queen}, there would be one law and one peace.{***}
str_npc7_kingsupport_2|Yes, Sire. If we succeed in our venture though I would ask you to allow me to carry out my experiments on the dead and the living. I could use your prisoners for this.{***}
str_npc8_kingsupport_2|I would -- on one condition. You allow me a position in your Kingsguard.{***}
str_npc9_kingsupport_2|Make it worth my effort and time and I would. As long as there's good money in 't, I'm your most loyal follower and supporter in this affair.{***}
str_npc10_kingsupport_2|Yes. If you do not forget Xhondo later and reward him well.{***}
str_npc11_kingsupport_2|Without doubt. I know you to be a friend of merchants like me, and as {King/Queen} I am sure you would respect us and protect our rights to trade unimpeded.{***}

str_npc12_kingsupport_2|You ask me that after I've cut down myriads of people while fighting under your banner? There is just one simple favour I would ask of you when you become a King though - lands and glory for myself.{***}

str_npc13_kingsupport_2|Moreover, I'd chop off the manhood of each of the men that dare not support you! And Chief, I need your promise to make smallfolk let us take some livestock and goods from them from time to time.{***}

str_npc14_kingsupport_2|Certainly. You're a man of your word and a valiant warrior. I believe you will not let neither bandits nor highborn lords hurt the smallfolk. My initial quest was to bring justice so that's what I ask of you.{***}

str_npc15_kingsupport_2|I would, but you should give me your word that you will do your best to guard the innocents from monsters like Ser Gregor Clegane. A good ruler is strong, but also honourable and just.{***}

str_kurleket_kingsupport_2|I would. I would tell anyone who listens of your deeds on behalf of the weak and helpless, of your ability to lead men against great odds and triumph, and tell them that if you were to become {king/queen}, there would be one law and one peace.{***}

str_thoros_kingsupport_2|I must be true to the visions I see in the fire and that vision is you leading the people to a better world. I will consult with the Red Priest of R'hllor in Myr to grant you support.{***}
str_dacey_kingsupport_2|I am willing to cast aside prior allegiances and convince others to assist you in claiming the Iron Throne.{***}
str_wunwun_kingsupport_2|Full bellies. You give that to Giants, we make you King.{***}
str_dongo_kingsupport_2|Dongo will tell all free folk that to be safe we need you to lead us.{***}
str_1_kingsupport_2|I have seen your valour and know your heart and for that I would be honoured to help you take the Iron Throne.{***}
str_2_kingsupport_2|I will go to the Vale and tell all nobles and commoners that you will protect the people and the realm, as I protected them on the path to the Eryie.{***}

str_3_kingsupport_2|I know many of the Knights of the Vale, most of which are upset about Lady Arryn not joining in this current war, even though honour demands it. We will find plenty of them willing to support your cause{***}

str_4_kingsupport_2|You have shown yourself a resourceful warrior and leader. I would not throw you out of my bed or geld you, but I won’t bow to you. If you want an Iron Throne I will stand next to you.{***}

str_5_kingsupport_2|Aye, I can see the lust for more in your eyes. You are more than willing to pay the “Iron Price” for the Iron Throne. If I help you, I expect to be named your Master of Ships. Why should I settle for a single ship if I am to be one of your sworn swords.{***}
str_6_kingsupport_2|I see the pain in your eyes as your men and your foes scream in agony from wounds. I know you want to heal the wounds of this land and bring peace.{***}

str_son_kingsupport_2|I would. I would tell anyone who listens of your deeds on behalf of the weak and helpless, of your ability to lead men against great odds and triumph, and tell them that if you were to become {king/queen}, there would be one law and one peace.{***}

str_daughter_kingsupport_2|I would. I would tell anyone who listens of your deeds on behalf of the weak and helpless, of your ability to lead men against great odds and triumph, and tell them that if you were to become {king/queen}, there would be one law and one peace.{***}

str_event_kingsupport_2|I would. I would tell anyone who listens of your deeds on behalf of the weak and helpless, of your ability to lead men against great odds and triumph, and tell them that if you were to become {king/queen}, there would be one law and one peace.{***}
str_npc1_kingsupport_2a|Please, go on.{***}
str_npc2_kingsupport_2a|Crown is gold and power. You will have a share of both.{***}
str_npc3_kingsupport_2a|I have no idea...{***}
str_npc4_kingsupport_2a|I will do what I can.{***}
str_npc5_kingsupport_2a|You have deserved it and you shall have it.{***}
str_npc6_kingsupport_2a|That sounds very flattering coming from a knight such as yourself Barristan.{***}
str_npc7_kingsupport_2a|I don't think you will do me any harm by that.{***}
str_npc8_kingsupport_2a|That sounds fair.{***}
str_npc9_kingsupport_2a|There's so much money in it you won't be able to carry it all.{***}
str_npc10_kingsupport_2a|The {king/queen} will never forget Xhondo!{***}
str_npc11_kingsupport_2a|You have my word on that.{***}
str_npc12_kingsupport_2a|You shall rightfully have it. What do you have in mind?{***}
str_npc13_kingsupport_2a|I believe they can manage without some of it. Granted.{***}
str_npc14_kingsupport_2a|The realm will have justice. Please go on.{***}
str_npc15_kingsupport_2a|I will do what I can.{***}
str_kurleket_kingsupport_2a|Please, go on.{***}
str_thoros_kingsupport_2a|Of course.{***}
str_dacey_kingsupport_2a|Excellent.{***}
str_wunwun_kingsupport_2a|Your belly shall be full.{***}
str_dongo_kingsupport_2a|The support of the Free Folk would be welcomed.{***}
str_1_kingsupport_2a|Of course.{***}
str_2_kingsupport_2a|A good move indeed.{***}
str_3_kingsupport_2a|A great plan.{***}
str_4_kingsupport_2a|I guess I should be happy with that at least.{***}
str_5_kingsupport_2a|The Iron price is what I shall pay if it helps me achieve my goal.{***}
str_6_kingsupport_2a|Of course and I hope with your help.{***}
str_son_kingsupport_2a|Please, go on.{***}
str_daughter_kingsupport_2a|Please, go on.{***}
str_event_kingsupport_2a|Please, go on.{***}
str_npc1_kingsupport_2b|Well. We saw how that turned out. Didn't we?{***}
str_npc2_kingsupport_2b|I have no intention of helping others, unless there's plenty of gold involved.{***}
str_npc3_kingsupport_2b|Yup I may as well have asked the horse.{***}
str_npc4_kingsupport_2b|Ser Gregor and his kind shall do with their peasants as they please.{***}
str_npc5_kingsupport_2b|Search for a free castle elsewhere.{***}
str_npc6_kingsupport_2b|I am struggling to believe your image of me are true.{***}
str_npc7_kingsupport_2b|Are you back to it again? Get out of my sight!{***}
str_npc8_kingsupport_2b|I'm sorry but my Kingsguard is already full.{***}
str_npc9_kingsupport_2b|Greedy bastard, get out of my face!{***}
str_npc10_kingsupport_2b|Xhondo asks too much for help of a beggar from the Summer Islands.{***}
str_npc11_kingsupport_2b|Forget it, I'm not going to support merchants.{***}
str_npc12_kingsupport_2b|Lands for a hedge knight? Are you in earnest?{***}
str_npc13_kingsupport_2b|You raid their villages every day and now you demand this?!{***}
str_npc14_kingsupport_2b|Protect the smallfolk? Forget it.{***}
str_npc15_kingsupport_2b|Ser Gregor and his kind shall do with their peasants as they please.{***}
str_kurleket_kingsupport_2b|I am sorry {my lord/my lady}, but I feel this is just not right.{***}
str_thoros_kingsupport_2b|Stuff your lord and his stupid light, I will have no part in this.{***}
str_dacey_kingsupport_2b|Then how am I to be sure your allegiance to me would not be so fragile?{***}
str_wunwun_kingsupport_2b|Their is not enough food in all the land to fill your belly you great oaf!{***}
str_dongo_kingsupport_2b|The Wildlings are useless rabble. I will not be needing them.{***}
str_1_kingsupport_2b|I am not sure I believe your sentiments.{***}
str_2_kingsupport_2b|I don't think that's the best approach.{***}
str_3_kingsupport_2b|I want no part in your scandals.{***}
str_4_kingsupport_2b|If I were to become {king/queen}, you would bow to me or take the black.{***}
str_5_kingsupport_2b|I see no good can come of this.{***}
str_6_kingsupport_2b|I am not sure you are able to help.{***}
str_son_kingsupport_2b|I am sorry {father/mother}, but I feel this is not right.{***}
str_daughter_kingsupport_2b|I am sorry {father/mother}, but I feel this is not right.{***}
str_event_kingsupport_2b|I am sorry {my lord/my lady}, but I feel this is not right.{***}

str_npc1_kingsupport_3|If I could go about this land for a few weeks. I have trained and worked with many great swordsmen. I shall let them know of you and your honour, they will be sure to join our cause.{***}

str_npc2_kingsupport_3|If you like, I can visit every brothel in Westeros and tell them the new {king/queen} will shit gold and enforce all whores to fuck for free. That should get you some support.{***}
str_npc3_kingsupport_3|PROTECTION! YES.. that's it.. protection. That's what I was saying. I shall find you more protection. How should I do that?{***}
str_npc4_kingsupport_3|Alright then. I shall meet with other smiths and tell them how life will improve with you on the throne. They will spread it across the realm and smiths will support you.{***}

str_npc5_kingsupport_3|I did not doubt your honour even for an instant. I shall strive to find all the living knights, lordling's and lords I have ever fought with and convince them of your cause being worthy to join.{***}
str_npc6_kingsupport_3|Then I shall head out right away. I have made a lot of friends in high places over my years and I'm sure they would be willing to support your cause.{***}

str_npc7_kingsupport_3|Excellent. Then I shall use all my connections to spread the word about your claim all over the realm. People of great and humble births alike will hear that you are the only one worthy of being supported.{***}
str_npc8_kingsupport_3|Good! Then give me a few weeks and I'll go about the courts of this land, letting it be known that you are the one true {king/queen} of the Iron Throne.{***}

str_npc9_kingsupport_3|I believe I will, s'why I am here, after all. Days and weeks will pass and people all over The Seven Kingdoms will hear of you, drink to your health and dream of your ascension to the throne, you have my word on it.{***}
str_npc10_kingsupport_3|Good. Xhondo will find a way to let every sailor of this land know about greatness of {playername}.{***}

str_npc11_kingsupport_3|If you promise to look out for the merchants and to make the roads safer then I will help you in your quest. I will meet with merchants, traders and guildsmen and speak of your claim. With their support, your right to the throne will be all the greater.{***}

str_npc12_kingsupport_3|Splendid, I knew you would understand my reasons for asking this of you. If I am to travel the land and spread tales of your valorous deeds, bringing knights and lordling's to your cause, I don't want to end up without any gratitude.{***}

str_npc13_kingsupport_3|I knew you would compromise with the mountain clans. How else are you to take the throne?! I'll let them know of your decision and you shall have the fiercest warriors in your host before long!{***}

str_npc14_kingsupport_3|Very well. Every peasant knows me as a former member of the Brotherhood Without Banners who shot criminals and other rabble on the roads. I will talk to them in villages and tell them of your just rule. You will have their support.{***}

str_npc15_kingsupport_3|Alright then. I shall meet with other squires and tell them how life will improve with you on the throne. They will spread it across the realm and young squires like myself will support you.{***}
str_kurleket_kingsupport_3|Very well {my lord/my lady}. Then I shall grab my gear and leave right away.{***}
str_thoros_kingsupport_3|Very well. I shall visit all the temples of the lord and seek your support.{***}
str_dacey_kingsupport_3|Very well, consider it done! I shall take my leave and rally the banners to support our new {king/queen}.{***}
str_wunwun_kingsupport_3|Then Wun Wun leave now to get support for more food.{***}
str_dongo_kingsupport_3|Dongo go see Free Folk. Dongo say {playername} is new king of all beyond the wall.{***}
str_1_kingsupport_3|Leave it to me and I will spread word of your deeds to every corner of the Riverlands and we will be one step closer to your goal.{***}
str_2_kingsupport_3|Very well. I shall make my way to the Vale and start spreading the word.{***}
str_3_kingsupport_3|Then I shall begin my mission right away and head into the heartlands of the Vale.{***}
str_4_kingsupport_3|Freefolk are not too big on bowing like Southerners, but I am certain I can convince many to take up your cause. Just don’t forget you must help us as well.{***}
str_5_kingsupport_3|So I shall spread the word of our new {king/queen} and gather supporters of your claim.{***}
str_6_kingsupport_3|I will seek out my fellow Orphans of the Greenblood, and tell them a new age is coming under your leadership.{***}
str_son_kingsupport_3|Very well {father/mother}. Then I shall grab my gear and leave right away.{***}
str_daughter_kingsupport_3|Very well {father/mother}. Then I shall grab my gear and leave right away.{***}
str_event_kingsupport_3|Very well {my lord/my lady}. Then I shall grab my gear and leave right away.{***}
str_npc1_kingsupport_objection|That loath can be seen and heard for miles. The sword of Braavos thinks you would be better off with him gone.{***}
str_npc2_kingsupport_objection|Your pissing in the wind with this one. You should have given his armour and horse to a warrior more fit for battles to come.{***}
str_npc3_kingsupport_objection|Nope! All hope is lost with that one!{***}

str_npc4_kingsupport_objection|Commander, that Summer Islander Xhondo you have entrusted with a task concerning your claim doesn't really give hope to me that he will be entirely honest with us while fulfilling it. I suggest keeping a close eye on him.{***}

str_npc5_kingsupport_objection|Commander, that soldier Nimble Dick you've sent on his quest is a slimy character. I know people like him, he'll be returning back with a purse full of golden dragons and an army to put us in chains till the rest of our days.{***}
str_npc6_kingsupport_objection|{My lord/My lady}, Bronn is no more than a sellsword, do you not think he will turn coat the moment someone offers him more coin than you do.{***}

str_npc7_kingsupport_objection|Sire, I know you have made common cause with that merchant, Hibald. I hardly believe his kind at all, he will more likely sell us to our enemies than acquire any support for our noble cause. Better send him on his way until it is too late.{***}
str_npc8_kingsupport_objection|I'm not so sure about that false knight, sire. He's dishonoured before and I'm sure he will do it again.{***}

str_npc9_kingsupport_objection|Commander, I have seen a lot of men good n' evil, but that former Maester you sent away with a task is the most dangerous man I've ever looked upon. He sends shivers down my spine with a glance. Better get rid of him.{***}
str_npc10_kingsupport_objection|Captain. Xhondo does not like trusting follower of Red God. Xhondo thinks those lunatics are capable of anything.{***}

str_npc11_kingsupport_objection|Leader, you've sent Gendry to the smiths to tell them how high you will value their work and how you will decrease the prices on materials thereby decreasing profit of merchants and traders all over the realm. That doesn't seem fair at all to me!{***}

str_npc12_kingsupport_objection|Commander, this sword for hire Bronn is a typical mercenary, a natural sellsword. I have seen enough of his kind in my life and I suggest you get rid of him, the sooner the better. Such people value gold more than allies.{***}

str_npc13_kingsupport_objection|Chief, that Ser Craven Longmouth that always speaks of how singers sing of him is worth nothing in a good battle. Don't you count on him to protect and support your claim. Just say the word and I'll chop his manhood off and feed it to the goats!{***}

str_npc14_kingsupport_objection|Captain, I heard that you had dispatched Shagga son of Dolf to the Mountains of the Moon to talk to other clans. You promised them that smallfolk would spare them some goods and livestock. I don't think that's just - fleecing poor peasants.{***}
str_npc15_kingsupport_objection|I'm sorry for speaking out but I just don't trust that man.{***}
str_kurleket_kingsupport_objection|I have had my eye on someone for some time now. Let's just say I trust them less than the voices heard in the gusts of winter.{***}
str_thoros_kingsupport_objection|I do not trust that Brienne, sire. You should tell her to take her leave.{***}
str_dacey_kingsupport_objection|Mormonts have been hunting Wildlings for as long as I can remember. You mark yourself as an enemy of the Free Folk by sending him out in your name.{***}
str_wunwun_kingsupport_objection|Little girl Mormont, fight good. Must crush niece of Crow King. Must protect free folk from her blade.{***}
str_dongo_kingsupport_objection|Dacey Mormont. Mormont, a name we fear and hate. The name of the Crow King, you make enemies of the free folk.{***}
str_1_kingsupport_objection|You could have sent a dozen rapist and killers with torches and accomplished the same thing. Qyburn will be forever stained as a member of the Brave Companions.{***}
str_2_kingsupport_objection|You just sent a criminal to praise your name and to ask for the people to support you. That tarnishes you and infuriates me.{***}
str_3_kingsupport_objection|You just sent the only person here that has to pay for protection to ask for support. You need warriors not merchants.{***}
str_4_kingsupport_objection|I doubt he will make it past the first tavern, Thoros is just a drunk and only cares where his next drink comes from.{***}
str_5_kingsupport_objection|You just sent little ole Dick to gain support. He should have been named Tiny. Don’t be surprised when people laugh at you for Tiny Dick.{***}
str_6_kingsupport_objection|I know you did what you thought was best by sending Mya to gather support. But she also has a claim to the Iron Throne. She may betray you.{***}
str_son_kingsupport_objection|I have had my eye on someone for some time now. Let's just say I trust them less than the voices heard in the gusts of winter.{***}
str_daughter_kingsupport_objection|I have had my eye on someone for some time now. Let's just say I trust them less than the voices heard in the gusts of winter.{***}
str_event_kingsupport_objection|I have had my eye on someone for some time now. Let's just say I trust them less than the voices heard in the gusts of winter.{***}
str_npc1_intel_mission|Well, as it happens, I have a few cousins over in {s17} that can tell us about {s18}.{***}
str_npc2_intel_mission|With a few gold coins the brothel in {s17} will tell me all I need to know about {s18}.{***}

str_npc3_intel_mission|Although it has been a long time since I visited the countryside of {s17}, I still might be able to make contact with some of its older and wiser residents. They are retired merchants, rich farmers, and owners of big herds. They do talk a lot of bullshit, but may be able to tell us quite a bit about the state of the {s18}.{***}

str_npc4_intel_mission|Commander, I could ask around the smithy over at {s17} of {s18}. Them peasants seem to know everything that happens in the realm so I believe we will have something to ponder upon when I return.{***}

str_npc5_intel_mission|Commander, an old veteran who is a big friend of mine lives in {s17}. I could visit him and drink to all the battles we've fought together and find out things you need to know about {s18}. Just say the word.{***}
str_npc6_intel_mission|If you need, I can go to {s17} and gain insight into {s18}.{***}

str_npc7_intel_mission|Sire, if you let me travel to {s17} where I've spent many a day tending to the wounded locals I will gather all the information about {s18}. Once you save someone's life he is indebted to you. These people won't leave a single rumour out.{***}
str_npc8_intel_mission|If you need, I can go to {s17} and gain insight into {s18}.{***}

str_npc9_intel_mission|Commander, information being one of my specialities there's no better source of it concerning {s18} than me. Give me leave to visit {s17} and after a while you'll have a bloody lot of latest news from it.{***}
str_npc10_intel_mission|Xhondo is brother to many other sailors in {s17}. They will speak. And with tales of {s18} Xhondo shall return.{***}

str_npc11_intel_mission|Leader, I do have certain ties with the guildsmen and merchants in {s17}. If you need to know about the political situation in {s18} I'm sure they'll have news to share with their old friend.{***}

str_npc12_intel_mission|Commander, if it's {s18} you want to know more of I could give you a hand in this. Many a noble man know me in {s17} and if you send me there, you will know everything on my return{***}

str_npc13_intel_mission|Chief, send Shagga to {s17} where people tremble at the sight of me and they will bury me under heaps of rumours and news of {s18}. If they leave anything you need to know out I'll return to them and chop their manhoods off!{***}

str_npc14_intel_mission|Captain, if you need information about current state of affairs in {s18} I can talk with smallfolk at {s17}. They always shared their knowledge with the Brotherhood Without Banners, so they won't turn down my request.{***}

str_npc15_intel_mission|Commander, I could ask around the for information over at {s17} of {s18}. Them peasants seem to know everything that happens in the realm so I believe we will have something to ponder upon when I return.{***}
str_kurleket_intel_mission|If you need {my lord/my lady}, I can go to {s17} and gain insight into {s18}.{***}
str_thoros_intel_mission|I know several of the Red Priest in {s17}, through these brothers of the faith I can learn what is happening in {s18}.{***}
str_dacey_intel_mission|If you need, I can go to {s17} and gain insight into {s18}.{***}
str_wunwun_intel_mission|I talk to last giants and free folk of {s17}. We make little people bow, or we break them.{***}
str_dongo_intel_mission|Give all free folk and giants home South of Wall and I talk in {s17}.{***}

str_1_intel_mission|House Grey is a small knightly house in the Riverlands, but we are highly respected from the roll we played in the Battle by the Lakeshore and Butcher’s Ball during the Dance of Dragons. I will have no trouble obtaining information about {s18} from the river lords.{***}

str_2_intel_mission|Every trader, nobleman, and commoner that has made the ascent to {s17} with me as their guide has always promised to help me whenever they could for protecting and guiding them. When I return from the Vale we should know a great deal more than we know today of {s18}.{***}
str_3_intel_mission|I have friends in the House Templeton of the Ninestars, one of the great knightly houses of the Vale. They will certainly cooperate with any request I make of them.{***}
str_4_intel_mission|I will visit my brother-in-law Mance Rayder, he will gladly let me know what is going on beyond the wall.{***}
str_5_intel_mission|I know Captain Greyjoy, she is the only person I need to see to know which way the winds are blowing on the Iron Islands.{***}
str_6_intel_mission|I know many of the merchants of {s17} from trading spice and cloth to them with my family. These merchants will certainly provide us with some information about {s18}.{***}
str_son_intel_mission|If you need {father/mother}, I can go to {s17} and gain insight into {s18}.{***}
str_daughter_intel_mission|If you need {father/mother}, I can go to {s17} and gain insight into {s18}.{***}
str_event_intel_mission|If you need {my lord/my lady}, I can go to {s17} and gain insight into {s18}.{***}
str_npc1_fief_acceptance|Than I shall be lord of {s17}, it would be a great honour.{***}
str_npc2_fief_acceptance|{s17} as a fief? Well, I've always thought myself as a lord.{***}
str_npc3_fief_acceptance|Well well Young One, it is most generous of you to offer me {s17}.{***}

str_npc4_fief_acceptance|Commander, I am just a smith, I wouldn't know how to rule {s17}. On the other hand... who else can be loved by smallfolk most if not one of low birth? One that was just like them? I thank you, Commander. I shall strive for my fief to prosper.{***}

str_npc5_fief_acceptance|That is honourable of you, Commander, to offer me {s17}. I shall accept it with due responsibility and strive to improve its state. Naturally, peasants of my fief will be trained by me to protect themselves and will make good recruits should you need them.{***}
str_npc6_fief_acceptance|Your House is growing strong {playername}. I shall be proud to accept {s17} as my own.{***}

str_npc7_fief_acceptance|Thank you, Sire, for granting me {s17}. This is a fine gift indeed! I always dreamed of having a land in possession. Now I shall strive to make it prosper to furthermore increase my incomes.{***}
str_npc8_fief_acceptance|Thank you your Grace. I shall defend {s17} in the name of your House.{***}

str_npc9_fief_acceptance|Now that's a reward I've been looking forward to! Dick Crabb, Lord o' {s17}, how does that sound? Soon golden dragons will flow to my pockets. Thank you, Commander, for this gift.{***}
str_npc10_fief_acceptance|Captain wants Xhondo looking over {s17}? Xhondo has no skill in this, it is not a ship to work on. But if Captain insists Xhondo will try.{***}

str_npc11_fief_acceptance|Are you offering me to hold {s17}, Leader? I accept your offer and rest assured I'll make it most profitable place in the whole realm. I can already see my investments bearing fruit. You won't regret your decision!{***}

str_npc12_fief_acceptance|Granting me {s17} is a rightful thing to do, Commander. I will not let you down, I swear it on my honour as a knight. This land will sing of my generous rule in a few months, no, in a few weeks!{***}

str_npc13_fief_acceptance|What a gift, Chief! Peasants in {s17} will worship Shagga son of Dolf as God of war soon enough! I'll train them to raid nearby villages and teach them how proper warriors fight!{***}

str_npc14_fief_acceptance|Me? Lord of {s17}? Captain, if that's not one of your jokes, I can tell you that I will protect the inhabitants of my fief to my last breath. I'll clear the surrounding lands of criminal scum and make this land peaceful and prosperous. Thank you for your faith in me, captain.{***}

str_npc15_fief_acceptance|My lord, you honour me with your offer. I shall be most useful to you and will hold {s17} in my name. I will strive to be the best and will always be your loyal servant. Farewell for now then, my lord.{***}
str_kurleket_fief_acceptance|Our House is growing strong {my lord/my lady}. I shall be proud to accept {s17} as my own.{***}
str_thoros_fief_acceptance|Your House is growing strong {playername}. I shall be proud to accept {s17} as my own.{***}
str_dacey_fief_acceptance|Your House is growing strong {playername}. I shall be proud to accept {s17} as my own.{***}
str_wunwun_fief_acceptance|Wun-Wun happy.{***}
str_dongo_fief_acceptance|Dongo eats better now.{***}
str_1_fief_acceptance|I gratefully accept this great honour you have bestowed upon me. I will do my best to protect your subjects and bring them into prosperity.{***}
str_2_fief_acceptance|My dream has come true, I have overcome my bastard birth and become noble.{***}
str_3_fief_acceptance|Blood and battle have elevated me to lordship! I hope I can live up to your expectations.{***}
str_4_fief_acceptance|I will send a messenger to my people to tell them they will find a warm hearth in my lands, you have kept your promise.{***}

str_5_fief_acceptance|This is the greatest moment of my life! I would have been grateful for just a ship. I am going to turn these peasants into the toughest bastards in the land.. and the richest.{***}
str_6_fief_acceptance|I will watch over {s17} and in your name protect the people and bring them to prosperity.{***}
str_son_fief_acceptance|Our House is growing strong {father/mother}. I shall be proud to accept {s17} as my own.{***}
str_daughter_fief_acceptance|Our House is growing strong {father/mother}. I shall be proud to accept {s17} as my own.{***}
str_event_fief_acceptance|Our House is growing strong {my lord/my lady}. I shall be proud to accept {s17} as my own.{***}
str_2_woman_to_woman|Men come and go. They lie, or die, or leave you. A mountain is not a man, though, and stone is a mountain's daughter. I trust my father, and I trust my mules. I won't fall.{***}

str_4_woman_to_woman|No matter where you come from a woman must do more to prove her worth. I have no doubt that you will become a legendary woman that all people will drink to for your heroic deeds.{***}

str_5_woman_to_woman|Let the men whisper behind your back all the nasty things their minds can conjure. We women will always get the last laugh when we show them that we know the quickest way to their hearts, a good sharp axe through the ribcage.{***}

str_6_woman_to_woman|Men think that a woman has no place on the battlefield, no place watching over the battlements of their own fief, or holding a throne. Take heart women such as Nymeria have proved them wrong just as you will. I think you will become even greater than her.{***}
str_npc1_turn_against|I'm sorry that we meet like this, {playername}.{***}
str_npc2_turn_against|No offence {playername} but it turned out someone was paying a lot more than you.{***}
str_npc3_turn_against|Oh {playername} -- what a tragic turn our lives have taken!{***}
str_npc4_turn_against|Well.... I'm not sure what to say. If we must fight, let's get it over with.{***}
str_npc5_turn_against|I'd rather meet with my worst and most feared enemy than with a man who once was my close friend, {playername}. It is a shame it came to this.{***}

str_npc6_turn_against|It grieves me more than anything I can say to meet you like this, {playername}. I shall not dwell on the circumstances that have led us to this point. I can only hope that we may one day be reconciled.{***}

str_npc7_turn_against|I am no warrior yet here I am, leading an army against you. I will honour our friendship and won't experiment on your body should I take you captive or find your corpse after battle's done.{***}
str_npc8_turn_against|So, we meet now as enemies, and may shortly face each other over the rims of our shields. A grim day this is.{***}
str_npc9_turn_against|Bloody Seven. Never thought to cross swords with you, {playername}. Let us end this fast.{***}
str_npc10_turn_against|Xhondo is not happy to fight {playername}. Forgive Xhondo.{***}

str_npc11_turn_against|By the Gods, I hoped this day would never come. The Seven have prepared a strange way for us to meet again, {playername}. Should I prevail, I will not feast on the victory.{***}

str_npc12_turn_against|Well met, {playername}. The circumstances of our meeting are rather unpleasant, but let us not waste our breath on words and let them sing of our glorious battle afterwards!{***}
str_npc13_turn_against|So now I get the chance to test my steel against yours, {playername}. Let us fight and the winner feast!{***}

str_npc14_turn_against|So that's how the Red God has seen fit to arrange our meeting. It pleasures me not at all to fight you, {playername}, but it seems we have no other choice. You must forgive me.{***}
str_npc15_turn_against|Well.. I'm not sure what to say. If we must fight, let's get it over with.{***}

str_kurleket_turn_against|It grieves me more than anything I can say to meet you like this, {my lord/my lady}. I shall not dwell on the circumstances that have led us to this point. I can only hope that we may one day be reconciled.{***}

str_thoros_turn_against|It grieves me more than anything I can say to meet you like this, {playername}. I shall not dwell on the circumstances that have led us to this point. I can only hope that we may one day be reconciled.{***}

str_dacey_turn_against|It grieves me more than anything I can say to meet you like this, {playername}. I shall not dwell on the circumstances that have led us to this point. I can only hope that we may one day be reconciled.{***}
str_wunwun_turn_against|Arrggghhhh!{***}
str_dongo_turn_against|Arrggghhhhh!{***}
str_1_turn_against|It gives me no pleasure to see you on the field of battle. Our past friendship will not slow my blade, I must do my duty, honour demands it.{***}
str_2_turn_against|I never thought I would be facing you in battle. I hope the gods spare you.{***}
str_3_turn_against|Defeating you will bring me much glory and wealth. I hold no grudge against you, today you shall see the Mad Mouse Prevail!{***}
str_4_turn_against|I regret that our paths lead us here. Don’t worry about becoming a wight, I will burn your corpse.{***}
str_5_turn_against|I am glad to see you are still carrying my favourite weapon. I look forward to removing it from your corpse.{***}
str_6_turn_against|I know today the fields will flow with blood, many will be killed or wounded. This isn’t my desire, but I must do what I must.{***}

str_son_turn_against|It grieves me more than anything I can say to meet you like this, {father/mother}. I shall not dwell on the circumstances that have led us to this point. I can only hope that we may one day be reconciled.{***}

str_daughter_turn_against|It grieves me more than anything I can say to meet you like this, {father/mother}. I shall not dwell on the circumstances that have led us to this point. I can only hope that we may one day be reconciled.{***}

str_event_turn_against|It grieves me more than anything I can say to meet you like this, {my lord/my lady}. I shall not dwell on the circumstances that have led us to this point. I can only hope that we may one day be reconciled.{***}
str_companion_strings_end|INVALID{***}
str_comment_intro_liege_affiliated|I am told that you are pledged to one of the usurpers who disputes my claim to the crown. But we may still talk.{***}
str_comment_intro_famous_liege|Your fame runs before you! Perhaps it is time that you sought a liege worthy of your valour.{***}
str_comment_intro_famous_martial|Your fame runs before you! Perhaps we shall test each other's valour in a tournament, or on the battlefield!{***}
str_comment_intro_famous_badtempered|I've heard of you. Well, I'm not one for bandying words, so if you have anything to say, out with it.{***}
str_comment_intro_famous_pitiless|I know your name. It strikes fear in men's hearts. That is good. Perhaps we should speak together, some time.{***}
str_comment_intro_famous_cunning|Ah, yes. At last we meet. You sound like a good {man/woman} to know. Let us speak together, from time to time.{***}
str_comment_intro_famous_sadistic|I know your name -- and from what I hear, I'll warrant that many a grieving widow knows too. But that is no concern of mine.{***}
str_comment_intro_famous_goodnatured|I've heard of you! It's very good to finally make your acquaintance.{***}
str_comment_intro_famous_upstanding|I know your name. They say you are a most valiant warrior. I can only hope that your honour and mercy matches your valour.{***}

str_comment_intro_noble_liege|I see that you carry a {nobleman's/noble's} banner, although I do not recognize the sigil. Know that I am always looking for good {men/warriors} to fight for me, once they prove themselves to be worthy of my trust.{***}
str_comment_intro_noble_martial|I see that you carry a nobleman's banner, but I do not recognize the sigil. No matter -- a brave {man's/warrior's} home is all the world, or so they say!{***}
str_comment_intro_noble_badtempered|I don't recognize the device on your banner. No doubt another foreigner come to our lands, as if we didn't have so many here already.{***}
str_comment_intro_noble_pitiless|I see that you carry a nobleman's banner, but I do not recognize the sigil. Another vulture come to grow fat on the leftovers of war, no doubt!{***}

str_comment_intro_noble_cunning|I see that you carry a nobleman's banner, but I do not recognize the sigil. Still, it is always worthwhile to make the acquaintance of {men/women} who may one day prove themselves to be great warriors.{***}

str_comment_intro_noble_sadistic|I see that you carry a nobleman's banner, but I do not recognize the sigil. Perhaps you are the bastard {son/daughter} of a puffed-up cattle thief? Or perhaps you stole it?{***}
str_comment_intro_noble_goodnatured|I see that you carry a nobleman's banner, but I do not recognize the sigil. Forgive my ignorance, {ser/my lady}! It is good to make your acquaintance.{***}

str_comment_intro_noble_upstanding|I see that you carry a nobleman's banner, but I do not recognize the sigil. No doubt you have come here in search of wealth and glory. If this indeed is the case, then I only ask that you show mercy to those poor souls caught in the path of war.{***}
str_comment_intro_common_liege|You may be of common birth, but know that I am always looking for good men to fight for me, if they can prove themselves to be worthy of my trust.{***}
str_comment_intro_common_martial|Perhaps you are not of gentle birth, but even a commoner, be {he/she} of sufficient valour, may make something of {himself/herself} some day.{***}
str_comment_intro_common_badtempered|Speak quickly, if you have anything to say, for I have no time to be bandying words with common soldiers of fortune.{***}
str_comment_intro_common_pitiless|You have the look of a mercenary, another vulture come to grow fat on the misery of this land.{***}
str_comment_intro_common_cunning|Well... I have not heard of you, but you have the look of a {man/woman} who might make something of {himself/herself}, some day.{***}
str_comment_intro_common_sadistic|Normally I cut the throats of impudent commoners who barge into my presence uninvited, but I am in a good mood today.{***}
str_comment_intro_common_goodnatured|Well, you look like a good enough sort.{***}
str_comment_intro_common_upstanding|Peace to you, and always remember to temper your valour with mercy, your courage with honour.{***}

str_comment_intro_female_famous_liege|I have heard much about you. Some men may fear a woman who is versed in the art of war, but I for one will not turn away hands that can grip a sword, should their owner be brave and loyal.{***}

str_comment_intro_female_famous_martial|I have heard much about you. They say that you are the equal of even the bravest of men in your prowess at arms. Perhaps one day I shall try my valour against yours, either in a tournament or on the battlefield!{***}
str_comment_intro_female_famous_badtempered|I've heard talk of you -- the woman who knows how to fight like a man.{***}
str_comment_intro_female_famous_pitiless|I know your name. It strikes fear in men's hearts. That is good. Perhaps we should speak together, some time.{***}
str_comment_intro_female_famous_cunning|Ah, yes. At last we meet. You sound like a good woman to know. Let us speak together, from time to time.{***}
str_comment_intro_female_famous_sadistic|I know your name -- and from what I hear, I'll warrant that many a grieving widow knows too. But that is no concern of mine.{***}
str_comment_intro_female_famous_goodnatured|I've heard of you! It's very good to finally make your acquaintance.{***}
str_comment_intro_female_famous_upstanding|I know your name. They say you are a most valiant warrior. I can only hope that your honour and mercy matches your valour.{***}

str_comment_intro_female_noble_liege|It is not often that I meet a woman who aspires to lead men into battle. But these are dark and troubled times, and I for one will not turn away hands that can grip a sword, should their owner be brave and loyal.{***}
str_comment_intro_female_noble_martial|I do not recognize the device on your banner, but clearly you are a lady of rank. Please consider me your most humble servant.{***}
str_comment_intro_female_noble_badtempered|I don't recognize the device on that banner. Clearly another foreigner come to our lands, bringing their strange ways.{***}

str_comment_intro_female_noble_pitiless|I see that you carry a nobles banner, but I do not recognize the device... You should know, lady, that here it is the men that ride to war, and if you seek to overturn the natural order of things, you will find your fair head stuck on a pike -- like that of any other rebel!{***}
str_comment_intro_female_noble_cunning|It is not unheard-of for a woman to seek her fortune on the battlefields, but neither is it usual. I shall be most interested in your progress.{***}

str_comment_intro_female_noble_sadistic|You appear to be of noble rank, but I don't recognize your banner. Clearly, another foreigner come to our shores -- no doubt from a land where men are weak, and the women ride to war in their place like the Amazons of old!{***}
str_comment_intro_female_noble_goodnatured|I see that you carry a nobleman's banner, but I do not recognize the device. Forgive my ignorance, my lady! It is good to make your acquaintance.{***}
